original: nas khral khrol tsam drus te chan du byas pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa zos na skom dad che ba la phan no //
analyzed: nas khral khrol tsam drus te chan du byas pa'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa zos na skom dad che ba la phan no //
translated: If one eats barley that has been threshed and ground into flour, mixed with honey and sugar, it will help those with a strong thirst.

original: de bzhin du nas dang 'bras dang / khre rgod rnying pa gang yang rung ba 'o ma dang thug par byas pa'i nang du kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa 'thungs na rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nas dang 'bras dang / khre rgod rnying pa gang yang rung ba 'o ma dang thug par byas pa'i nang du kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa 'thungs na rab tu bsngags so //
translated: In the same way, it is highly recommended to drink any kind of barley, rice, or old wheat, mixed with milk, curd, honey, and sugar.

original: skom dad che ba'i nad yod pas ni thog mar chu grang gis lus bkrus la /
analyzed: skom dad che ba'i nad yod pas ni thog mar chu grang gis lus bkrus la /
translated: Those who have a strong thirst should first wash their body with cold water.

original: de'i 'og tu bsil ba'i sman thams cad bskol ba'i khu ba dang / 'o ma las gzhi blangs pa'i bza' ba grang mo'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa sbyin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsil ba'i sman thams cad bskol ba'i khu ba dang / 'o ma las gzhi blangs pa'i bza' ba grang mo'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa sbyin no //
translated: After that, they should be given a drink of a broth made by boiling all the cooling medicines, and cold food made from milk, mixed with honey and sugar.

original: yang na srog chags thang las skyes pa'i sha khu'i nang du mar bskol ba bcug la lan tshva dang skyur med par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na srog chags thang las skyes pa'i sha khu'i nang du mar bskol ba bcug la lan tshva dang skyur med par bya ste /
translated: Or, one should prepare a broth of the meat of animals born on dry land, add clarified butter, and make it free of salt and sour ingredients.

original: bza' ba dang lhan cig sbyin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang lhan cig sbyin no //
translated: It should be given together with food.

original: yang na sran mungga la sogs pa bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / 'tsho byed sde bcu las gzhi blangs pa'i g-yos su byas pa la yang rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: yang na sran mungga la sogs pa bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa dang / 'tsho byed sde bcu las gzhi blangs pa'i g-yos su byas pa la yang rab tu bsngags so //
translated: Or it is highly recommended to use a cooling substance such as mung beans, or a soup made from the ten roots of life.

original: gzhan yang 'o ma bsrubs pa'i mar sar ram /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'o ma bsrubs pa'i mar sar ram /
translated: Moreover, it is very good to inhale ghee churned from milk,

original: sman bsil bag bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: sman bsil bag bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
translated: a decoction of cooling herbs,

original: yang na bu @193b ram shing gi khu ba gang yang rung ba snar blugs pa yang rab tu bzang ngo //
analyzed: yang na bu @193b ram shing gi khu ba gang yang rung ba snar blugs pa yang rab tu bzang ngo //
translated: or a decoction of bhurlodhra.

original: mdo'i gnas su bstan pa'i mkhur bar bcang ba'i sman 'o ma dang / bu ram chang dang / kha ra'i khu ba la sogs pa yang kha skam pa dang skom dad che ba la phan te mkhur bar bcang ngo //
analyzed: mdo'i gnas su bstan pa'i mkhur bar bcang ba'i sman 'o ma dang / bu ram chang dang / kha ra'i khu ba la sogs pa yang kha skam pa dang skom dad che ba la phan te mkhur bar bcang ngo //
translated: The medicines for the mouth taught in the sutras, such as milk, molasses, and sugarcane juice, are also beneficial for dry mouth and excessive thirst. They should be kept in the mouth.

original: gzhan yang tsha ba'i rims la ji ltar byugs pa dang bsku ba smos pa 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang tsha ba'i rims la ji ltar byugs pa dang bsku ba smos pa 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: Moreover, the anointing and massage mentioned for treating hot fevers should also be applied here.

original: mya ngan dang mi dga' ba spangs te sems bde bar 'gyur ba'i bag bsten to //
analyzed: mya ngan dang mi dga' ba spangs te sems bde bar 'gyur ba'i bag bsten to //
translated: Abandoning sorrow and unhappiness, one should rely on things that bring mental happiness.

original: mtsho chen po dang mtsho chung ngu la sogs pa nyams su dga' ba bsten pa'am /
analyzed: mtsho chen po dang mtsho chung ngu la sogs pa nyams su dga' ba bsten pa'am /
translated: One should rely on the great ocean, small lakes, and so forth that are delightful.

original: dran du gzhug go //
analyzed: dran du gzhug go //
translated: One should resort to or recollect delightful great lakes, small lakes, and so on.

original: de dag ni skom dad kyi cho ga spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni skom dad kyi cho ga spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are the general teachings on the ritual for thirst.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni zho bu ram dang sbyar ba bsngags so //
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni zho bu ram dang sbyar ba bsngags so //
translated: In the case of thirst arising from wind, a mixture of whey and molasses is recommended.

original: yang na lus nyams stobs bskyed cing bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman sha khu dang lhan cig sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na lus nyams stobs bskyed cing bsil ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sman sha khu dang lhan cig sbyar ba'am /
translated: Or, one should drink a soup of meat with a medicine that increases physical strength and has a cooling potency.

original: yang na bi da ri'i sde tshan bskol ba bsgrangs pa 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: yang na bi da ri'i sde tshan bskol ba bsgrangs pa 'thungs na phan no //
translated: Or, one should drink a decoction of the Vidari class.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa la ni au dumb'a ra bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ra dkar po btab pa 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa la ni au dumb'a ra bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ra dkar po btab pa 'thungs na phan no //
translated: In the case of thirst arising from bile, one should drink a decoction of boiled Udumbara mixed with white sugar.

original: yang na au dumb'a ra bskol ba'i khu ba bsgrangs pa'i nang du sha kha ra btab pa btung ba'am /
analyzed: yang na au dumb'a ra bskol ba'i khu ba bsgrangs pa'i nang du sha kha ra btab pa btung ba'am /
translated: Or, one should drink a decoction of boiled Udumbara mixed with meat sugar.

original: yang na thal tres kyi sde tshan bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ras btab pa btung ba'am /
analyzed: yang na thal tres kyi sde tshan bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ras btab pa btung ba'am /
translated: Or one should drink a decoction of the group of astringents with sugar added.

original: de bzhin du pa ru sha ka dang sle tres la sogs pa'i sde tshan bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta'o //🔽yang na mngar ba'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du shing 'o ma can n+ya gro dha la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa sbyin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du pa ru sha ka dang sle tres la sogs pa'i sde tshan bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa yang de dang 'dra bar blta'o // yang na mngar ba'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du shing 'o ma can n+ya gro dha la sogs pa bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa sbyin no //
translated: Similarly, one should view a decoction of the group of parushaka, leeches, etc. with sugar and honey added in the same way.🔽Or one should give a decoction of sweet medicines such as grapes, with sugar and honey added.

original: yang na skyur rtsi chen po dang / rgun 'bru'i lcug ma dang / n+ya gro dha dang / lcang ma dang / 'di rnams kyi lo ma dang / ku sha dang sha ka la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rtsa ba lnga dang / shing mngar dang 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: yang na skyur rtsi chen po dang / rgun 'bru'i lcug ma dang / n+ya gro dha dang / lcang ma dang / 'di rnams kyi lo ma dang / ku sha dang sha ka la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rtsa ba lnga dang / shing mngar dang 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'am /
translated: Or one should give a decoction of the five root medicines such as large sour jujube, grape vine, nyagrodha, bamboo, and the leaves of these, and kusha, shaka, etc., with sweet wood and these boiled in water.

original: yang na rims nad gso ba'i skabs su bshad pa'i snying po lnga'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa bskol ba'am /
analyzed: yang na rims nad gso ba'i skabs su bshad pa'i snying po lnga'i sman rgun 'brum la sogs pa bskol ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, one may administer a decoction of grapes and the other five heart-subduing medicines explained in the chapter on treating contagious diseases.

original: sbyor ba de dag gang yang rung ba blud na /🔽mkhris pa @194a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba de dag gang yang rung ba blud na / mkhris pa @194a * //
translated: If one administers any of these compounds,🔽it will cure thirst caused by

original: las gyur pa'i skom dad sel to //
analyzed: las gyur pa'i skom dad sel to //
translated: bile.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i skom pa'i nad la ni thog mar nim pa bskol ba'i khu ba blud de skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i skom pa'i nad la ni thog mar nim pa bskol ba'i khu ba blud de skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: For treating thirst caused by phlegm, one should first administer a decoction of nimba and induce vomiting.

original: yang na bil ba dang / 'u su dang / rtsa ba lnga pa chung ngu dang / dar ba dang / tsi tra ka dang / 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na bil ba dang / 'u su dang / rtsa ba lnga pa chung ngu dang / dar ba dang / tsi tra ka dang / 'di rnams chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one should administer a decoction of bilva, ushira, the lesser five roots, daraba, and citraka, boiled in water.

original: yang na yungs chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa btung ba'am /
analyzed: yang na yungs chu dang bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa btung ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of mustard seeds boiled in water, to which honey and sugar have been added.

original: yang na mungga dang / pa to la dang / nim pa rnam gnyis kyi lo ma bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du tsha ba gsum gyi phye mas btab pa btung ngo //
analyzed: yang na mungga dang / pa to la dang / nim pa rnam gnyis kyi lo ma bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du tsha ba gsum gyi phye mas btab pa btung ngo //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of sesame, patola, and the two nimba leaves, to which the three hot medicines have been added.

original: gzhan yang nas las byas pa'i zan dang / sman gyi khu ba mkhur bar bcang pa dang / sman sna nas gtang ba dang lde gu la sogs pa'i sman tsha ba'i bag dang bcas pa sbyin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang nas las byas pa'i zan dang / sman gyi khu ba mkhur bar bcang pa dang / sman sna nas gtang ba dang lde gu la sogs pa'i sman tsha ba'i bag dang bcas pa sbyin no //
translated: Moreover, one should give food prepared with the three spices, medicinal decoctions to be held in the mouth, medicinal powders to be taken through the nose, and medicines such as medicinal butters with a hot tendency.

original: ma zhu ba dang bcas pa'i skom dad che ba'i nad la ni gong du smos pa'i sbyor ba rnams bya ste /
analyzed: ma zhu ba dang bcas pa'i skom dad che ba'i nad la ni gong du smos pa'i sbyor ba rnams bya ste /
translated: In the case of a patient with a strong thirst due to indigestion, one should apply the above-mentioned remedies.

original: khyad par du skyug sman gyis zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du skyug sman gyis zhi bar bya'o //
translated: In particular, one should treat it with emetics.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan yang tsha ba gsum dang go bye dang / shu dag dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma bal po se'u'i khu ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan yang tsha ba gsum dang go bye dang / shu dag dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma bal po se'u'i khu ba 'am /
translated: Similarly, one should prepare another remedy with the three spices, coriander, and cumin, and give it with the juice of rose apples,

original: chu dron nam zho ga chu gang yang rung ba dang sbyar te btang na /
analyzed: chu dron nam zho ga chu gang yang rung ba dang sbyar te btang na /
translated: hot water, or curd-water, whichever is appropriate.

original: skom dad ma zhu ba dang bcas pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: skom dad ma zhu ba dang bcas pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: This will cure thirst with indigestion.

original: gal te nad pa zas stobs chung na zas shin tu sla ba dang / skyo ma gang yang rung ba dus tshod dang sbyar te gtang ngo //
analyzed: gal te nad pa zas stobs chung na zas shin tu sla ba dang / skyo ma gang yang rung ba dus tshod dang sbyar te gtang ngo //
translated: If the patient is weak, one should give very light food and any kind of soup, in accordance with the time.

original: ngal bas skom dad skyes pa la ni sha khu'am sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i skyo ma blud do ;🔽/ tsha bas skom dad skye ba la ni nas kyi phye'am /
analyzed: ngal bas skom dad skyes pa la ni sha khu'am sha kha ra dang sbyar ba'i skyo ma blud do ; / tsha bas skom dad skye ba la ni nas kyi phye'am /
translated: If thirst arises from fatigue, give a drink of meat broth or a gruel made with meat and sugar.🔽If thirst arises from heat, give a drink of a gruel made with barley flour

original: rgya shug gi phye ma'i skyo ma kha ra dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: rgya shug gi phye ma'i skyo ma kha ra dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: or jujube flour and sugar.

original: yang na til gyi tshigs ma btags te rang skyur dang sbyar bas lus thams cad bskus na tsha ba 'jil lo //
analyzed: yang na til gyi tshigs ma btags te rang skyur dang sbyar bas lus thams cad bskus na tsha ba 'jil lo //
translated: Alternatively, if the whole body is anointed with a paste of sesame seeds and sour gruel, the fever will be overcome.

original: lus khrus byas pas skom dad skyed pa la ni chang ngam chus bsres pa'am /
analyzed: lus khrus byas pas skom dad skyed pa la ni chang ngam chus bsres pa'am /
translated: If thirst arises from bathing, give a drink of beer mixed with water,

original: yang na bu ram chu blud do //
analyzed: yang na bu ram chu blud do //
translated: or give a drink of sugar cane juice.

original: chang 'thungs pas skom dad skyed pa la ni chu dang chang phyed mar bsres pa blud de /
analyzed: chang 'thungs pas skom dad skyed pa la ni chu dang chang phyed mar bsres pa blud de /
translated: If thirst arises from drinking beer, give a drink of water mixed with half beer.

original: de nas lus khrus byas la zas skyur dang lan tshva dang ldan par sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas lus khrus byas la zas skyur dang lan tshva dang ldan par sbyin no //
translated: Then, after bathing, give sour and salty food.

original: snum pa dang ldan pa'i zas rno ches pa zos pas me drod skyes @194b te skom dad byung ba la ni chu rang bzhin gyis grang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: snum pa dang ldan pa'i zas rno ches pa zos pas me drod skyes @194b te skom dad byung ba la ni chu rang bzhin gyis grang ba sbyin no //
translated: If thirst arises from the digestive heat that arises from eating very sharp food that is oily, give naturally cold water.

original: snum ma zhu ba las skom dad skyes pa la ni chu dron po sbyin no //🔽snum bag zhu nas skom dad skyes pa la ni thug pa gar po blud do //
analyzed: snum ma zhu ba las skom dad skyes pa la ni chu dron po sbyin no // snum bag zhu nas skom dad skyes pa la ni thug pa gar po blud do //
translated: If thirst arises from undigested oil, give warm water.🔽If thirst arises from digested oil, give thin gruel.

original: snum dang ldan pa'i zas zos pa las skom dad skyes pa la ni snod nang du kha ba bcug la ;
analyzed: snum dang ldan pa'i zas zos pa las skom dad skyes pa la ni snod nang du kha ba bcug la ;
translated: If thirst arises from eating oily food, put snow in a container,

original: de'i steng du bu ram dang chu blugs bzhin du btung ngo //
analyzed: de'i steng du bu ram dang chu blugs bzhin du btung ngo //
translated: and drink it as if pouring water and sugar on top.

original: zas lci ba zos pa las skom dad skyes pa la ni /
analyzed: zas lci ba zos pa las skom dad skyes pa la ni /
translated: If thirst arises from eating heavy food,

original: chu dron po blud de skyug tu gzhug go //
analyzed: chu dron po blud de skyug tu gzhug go //
translated: give warm water and induce vomiting.

original: glo gcong zad byed kyi skom dad skyes pa la ni /
analyzed: glo gcong zad byed kyi skom dad skyes pa la ni /
translated: If thirst arises from phthisis,

original: glo gcong la phan pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang nyams stobs skyed pa'i sman thams cad 'dir sbyar ro //
analyzed: glo gcong la phan pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba dang nyams stobs skyed pa'i sman thams cad 'dir sbyar ro //
translated: here all the foods, drinks, and tonics that are beneficial for phthisis are applied.

original: lus rid pa dang nyams stobs chung ba dang / zas rtsub pa zos pa las skom dang skyes pa la ni 'o ma'am ra sha'i khu ba sbyin no //
analyzed: lus rid pa dang nyams stobs chung ba dang / zas rtsub pa zos pa las skom dang skyes pa la ni 'o ma'am ra sha'i khu ba sbyin no //
translated: If thirst arises from emaciation, weakness, and eating coarse food, give milk or goat's milk.

original: stod du byung ba'i rlung gi nyes pas skom dad skyes pa la ni /
analyzed: stod du byung ba'i rlung gi nyes pas skom dad skyes pa la ni /
translated: If thirst arises due to the fault of wind in the upper part of the body,

original: lud pa zad byed la phan pa'i sman 'o ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: lud pa zad byed la phan pa'i sman 'o ma dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: give a drink of medicine that stops phlegm mixed with milk.

original: nang gang yang rung ba'i rkyen gyis skom dad skyes pa la ni /
analyzed: nang gang yang rung ba'i rkyen gyis skom dad skyes pa la ni /
translated: If thirst arises due to any condition in the middle part of the body,

original: 'u su bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ra dkar po dang sbrang rtsi btab la blud do //
analyzed: 'u su bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du kha ra dkar po dang sbrang rtsi btab la blud do //
translated: give a drink of a decoction of ushira mixed with white sugar and honey.

original: gzhan yang skom dad nad gang las gyur pa brtags te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skom dad nad gang las gyur pa brtags te /
translated: Moreover, having examined from which illness thirst arises,

original: de dang mthun par btung ba byin pa shin tu bsngags so //
analyzed: de dang mthun par btung ba byin pa shin tu bsngags so //
translated: it is highly praised to give a drink in accordance with that.

original: gal te ma zhu ba las skom dad skyes te chu 'gags pa las lus sha zad par snang na /
analyzed: gal te ma zhu ba las skom dad skyes te chu 'gags pa las lus sha zad par snang na /
translated: If thirst arises from indigestion and the body appears to be wasting away due to a blockage of water,

original: de ni shi ba'am yang na yun ring du na bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni shi ba'am yang na yun ring du na bar 'gyur te /
translated: that person will either die or become sick for a long time.

original: de la ni myur du ci 'dod pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dang sman byin na de ma thag skom dad zhi bar gyur na nad gzhan yang gso bar nus so //
analyzed: de la ni myur du ci 'dod pa'i bza' ba dang btung ba dang sman byin na de ma thag skom dad zhi bar gyur na nad gzhan yang gso bar nus so //
translated: If one quickly gives them whatever food, drink, and medicine they desire, if the thirst is immediately relieved, one will be able to cure other illnesses as well.

original: gso ba'i gnas las le'u drug pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gso ba'i gnas las le'u drug pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Healing chapter.

original: // / de nas chang nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas chang nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on curing alcoholism will be explained.

original: thog mar sman pas rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi gang shas che ba legs par brtags te dang po shas gang che ba gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar sman pas rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi gang shas che ba legs par brtags te dang po shas gang che ba gso bar bya'o //
translated: First, the physician should carefully examine which of the humors, wind and so forth, is most imbalanced. First, one should cure the one that is most imbalanced.

original: nad gzhi shas mnyam pa'i chang nad la ni /
analyzed: nad gzhi shas mnyam pa'i chang nad la ni /
translated: In the case of alcoholism where the humors are equally imbalanced,

original: dang po bad kan gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang po bad kan gso bar bya ste /
translated: one should first cure the phlegm.

original: rim gyis mkhris pa dang rlung yang gso'o //
analyzed: rim gyis mkhris pa dang rlung yang gso'o //
translated: Then, gradually one should cure the bile and wind.

original: de ltar rim gyis gso ba ni dang po bad kan gyi gnas su 'khrugs shing /
analyzed: de ltar rim gyis gso ba ni dang po bad kan gyi gnas su 'khrugs shing /
translated: Thus, the gradual cure is because first the phlegm is disturbed in its place,

original: de nas mkhris pa dang rlung @195a * //
analyzed: de nas mkhris pa dang rlung @195a * //
translated: then the bile and wind

original: yang 'khrugs bas gso ba yang de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'khrugs bas gso ba yang de ltar bya'o //
translated: are also disturbed. The cure should be done in that way.

original: de la chang nyung du 'thungs pa dang / yang na mang du 'thungs pa dang log par 'thungs pa las chang nad skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la chang nyung du 'thungs pa dang / yang na mang du 'thungs pa dang log par 'thungs pa las chang nad skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that regard, alcoholism arises from drinking little alcohol, or from drinking a lot, or from drinking incorrectly.

original: de la ni sngar chang gang 'thungs pa de nyid blud pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni sngar chang gang 'thungs pa de nyid blud pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, by giving the very same alcohol that was drunk before, it will be pacified.

original: chang dang dug gnyis ni rno ba la sogs pa'i nus pa mnyam par bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: chang dang dug gnyis ni rno ba la sogs pa'i nus pa mnyam par bshad mod kyi /
translated: It is said that alcohol and poison have the same potency, such as sharpness.

original: chang bas dug gi mthu ni shin tu che'o //
analyzed: chang bas dug gi mthu ni shin tu che'o //
translated: However, the power of poison is much greater than that of alcohol.

original: chang mang du 'thungs pa la ni gang gi rang bzhin shin tu rno ba dang / dro bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chang mang du 'thungs pa la ni gang gi rang bzhin shin tu rno ba dang / dro bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: For one who drinks a lot of alcohol, the nature of the alcohol becomes very sharp and hot.

original: de'i 'og tu skyur zhing tsha ba bskyed de zas kyi bcud mi 'ju ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skyur zhing tsha ba bskyed de zas kyi bcud mi 'ju ba'am /
translated: After that, it produces sourness and heat, causing the essence of food not to digest.

original: yang na log par 'ju ste rul zhing myags par byed la /
analyzed: yang na log par 'ju ste rul zhing myags par byed la /

analyzed: chang mang du 'thungs pa las khong pa'i nang du drod cher skyes te /

analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis rang gi srog bsrung ba'i phyir chang ran par btung bar bya'o //

analyzed: stan rgya che zhing bde bar bting nas mi srun pa'i skye bo rnams bsal te /

analyzed: mdza' bshes dang / g-yog 'khor yid du 'ong zhing rang gi snyan pa sgrogs pa rnams dang / lhan cig tu 'dug par bya'o //

original: yang na bud med gzhon nu 'jo sgeg dang ldan pa dag rol mo snyan pa'i sgra dang lhan cig gar dang glu len cing shin tu mdzes pa dang / bud med de dag gi lus la dril bu g-yer ka'i sgra dang bcas pa dang / rma bya la sogs pa'i gar dang /
analyzed: yang na bud med gzhon nu 'jo sgeg dang ldan pa dag rol mo snyan pa'i sgra dang lhan cig gar dang glu len cing shin tu mdzes pa dang / bud med de dag gi lus la dril bu g-yer ka'i sgra dang bcas pa dang / rma bya la sogs pa'i gar dang /

analyzed: de yang phyug po'i rigs su skyes shing nu ma rgyas pa dang / ro smad lci ba'i 'gros su 'gro ba dang / gdong zla ba lta bu'i bud med rgan po yang dregs pa skyed pa dang / gzhan pa'i sems kyang kun tu chags pa skyed nus pa dang /
translated: Moreover, a woman who is born into a wealthy family, has full breasts, walks with a heavy gait, and has a face like the moon, even if she is an old woman, generates pride. She is able to generate attachment in others.

analyzed: bud med dar la bab cing lus srab pa chang gis dregs pa /

analyzed: chang de yang tsu ta'i me tog dang / gla rtsi dang / sna ma'i me tog dmar pos bsgos la shel phor gyi snod kyi nang du blugs te mdzes pa ni 'dod pa'i lha'i lus bzhin du snang ngo //

translated: When drinking beer, first eat flour or

analyzed: de'i 'og tu chang 'dod pa'i skyes bus sa phyogs zhal zhal byas pa'i steng du chang gi nang du chu cung zad dang bsres la btung ste /

analyzed: dran pa dang blo dang ldan pa'i skyes bus mi che mi chung bar ran par rtag tu spyad de /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu zas kyi bya ba legs par sbyar ba dang nye bar spyad par bya ste /

analyzed: thog mar bud med la blud de /

analyzed: bud med des kyang chang gi nang du dri zhim pos byugs pa'i gdong dang / autpa la kha phye ba lta bu'i mig gis bltas pas bung ba mang pos chang 'thung ba lta bu'i gzugs brnyan shin tu mdzes par snang ba'i chang de snod gsum gyi nang du blugs te /

analyzed: 'khor rnams kyis bstod bzhin du 'thungs na /

analyzed: 'dir yang sha dang / snum khur dang / mar dang / sge'u gsher dang / ha ri ta la sogs pa dang / kha ru tsha dang ldan par zas bza'o //

analyzed: gsang nan du skyogs gnyis sam gsum nyung ba btung bar bya ste /

analyzed: de ma thag chang blangs la bud med la blud do //

analyzed: phal cher sdug bsngal dang bcas pas dmyal ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For the most part, it is like hell, since it is accompanied by suffering.🔽In this way, the woman drinks the wine, which has an excellent color.

translated: The remainder of the wine has an extremely pleasant smell, the color of a crushed red lotus.🔽Afterward, when she is tired from lovemaking, she should drink a little wine.

analyzed: gal te chang mangs na ni gzi mdangs nyams pas chang mang du 'thung ba spang ngo //

original: de nas bde bar nyal bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bde bar nyal bar bya'o //
translated: Then, you should sleep happily.

original: chang btung ba'i tshul de ltar byas na /
analyzed: chang btung ba'i tshul de ltar byas na /
translated: If you drink beer in this way,

analyzed: chos dang don 'dod pas nyams par mi 'gyur te snying po med pa'i 'khor ba na bde ba'i mchog tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

translated: This procedure is also for those gods and humans who have wealth, but if it is otherwise, then you will be tormented by poverty.

original: de'i 'og tu sems gdungs nas nor bu 'bud cing rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems gdungs nas nor bu 'bud cing rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, your mind will be tormented and you will be ruined.

original: skyes bu 'jungs pa dag ni gzhan longs spyod byed pa dag la smod cing bdag nyid la 'byor pa yod na yang mi spyod pa dag ni gzhan gyi nor bsrung ba'i mdzod dang mtshungs so ;

translated: Stingy people criticize others who enjoy themselves, and even if they themselves are wealthy, they do not enjoy themselves. They are like a treasure house that protects the wealth of others.

original: /'on kyang rim pa de ltar chang 'thungs na tshe la phan zhing dbang po rnams su yul bskams te /
analyzed: /'on kyang rim pa de ltar chang 'thungs na tshe la phan zhing dbang po rnams su yul bskams te /

original: rang dgar 'gro ba las rgyal ba yin no //
analyzed: rang dgar 'gro ba las rgyal ba yin no //
translated: He is victorious over the freedom of movement of the mind.

original: cho ga de dag ni nor dang ldan pa rnams kyis bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga de dag ni nor dang ldan pa rnams kyis bya'o //
translated: These are the rules for drinking alcohol.

original: de lta bas na chang ji ltar rigs pa dang phan pa ran par sbyar te /
analyzed: de lta bas na chang ji ltar rigs pa dang phan pa ran par sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, alcohol should be taken in the proper way, in a way that is beneficial and in a moderate amount.

original: de yang bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis mthong ba nyams par mi 'gyur zhing sems mi 'khrul ba'i tshod kyis btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid chen po rnams kyis mthong ba nyams par mi 'gyur zhing sems mi 'khrul ba'i tshod kyis btung bar bya'o //
translated: And that should be done in a way that does not impair the vision of the great beings and does not disturb the mind.

original: de nas ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: After that, it should be abandoned.

original: gzhan yang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi mi la chang blud pa ni dang por bsku byug dang lus dril ba dang khrus byas la bza' pa ni snum dang dro ba bzung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi mi la chang blud pa ni dang por bsku byug dang lus dril ba dang khrus byas la bza' pa ni snum dang dro ba bzung ngo //
translated: Moreover, for a person whose nature is windy, alcohol should be given first as an ointment, as a massage, and as a bath. As food, he should eat oily and warm things.

original: btung ba ni chang btung ba dang / byug pa rnams kyis bsgos la blud do //
analyzed: btung ba ni chang btung ba dang / byug pa rnams kyis bsgos la blud do //
translated: As drink, he should drink alcohol mixed with ointments.

original: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi la ni bsil ba'i sbyor ba sna tshogs dang / mngar ba dang / snum pa dang bcas pa'i zas dang chang gi btung ba byin na yang lus nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi la ni bsil ba'i sbyor ba sna tshogs dang / mngar ba dang / snum pa dang bcas pa'i zas dang chang gi btung ba byin na yang lus nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For a person of a bilious nature, various cooling preparations, sweet and oily foods, and alcoholic beverages should be given, and the body should not be weakened.

original: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi mi la ni nas dang gro la sogs pa dro ba'i zas dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha na le sham la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i zas dang chang btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi mi la ni nas dang gro la sogs pa dro ba'i zas dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha na le sham la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i zas dang chang btung bar bya'o //
translated: For a person of a phlegm nature, warm foods such as barley, wheat, etc., and the meat of animals living on dry land, prepared with long pepper, etc., and alcoholic beverages should be given.

original: de la phal cher rlung nad la phan pa'i chang ni btags pa las @200b byas ba'i chang dang bu ram chang phan no //
analyzed: de la phal cher rlung nad la phan pa'i chang ni btags pa las @200b byas ba'i chang dang bu ram chang phan no //
translated: Among them, the alcoholic beverages that are mostly beneficial for wind disorders are those made from molasses and those made from fermented mash.

original: mkhris pa'i nad la ni rgun chang chu cung zad dang bsres pa blud do //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i nad la ni rgun chang chu cung zad dang bsres pa blud do //
translated: For bile disorders, grape wine mixed with a little water should be given.

original: bad kan gyi nad la ni rgun chang ngam aa rishta'i btung ba'am sbrang chang btung ngo //
analyzed: bad kan gyi nad la ni rgun chang ngam aa rishta'i btung ba'am sbrang chang btung ngo //
translated: For phlegm disorders, grape wine, the drink of arichtha, or mead should be drunk.

original: bad kan shas che ba'i nang la ni sngar chang blud la de'i 'og tu zas bza'o //🔽mkhris pa shas che ba la ni chang 'thungs la de ma thag zas bza'o //
analyzed: bad kan shas che ba'i nang la ni sngar chang blud la de'i 'og tu zas bza'o // mkhris pa shas che ba la ni chang 'thungs la de ma thag zas bza'o //
translated: For those with a predominance of phlegm, first give them alcohol and then let them eat.🔽For those with a predominance of bile, let them drink alcohol and then eat immediately.

original: rlung shas che ba la ni zas phyed zos nas chang btung ngo //
analyzed: rlung shas che ba la ni zas phyed zos nas chang btung ngo //
translated: For those with a predominance of wind, let them drink alcohol after they have eaten half of their food.

original: nad gzhi mnyam pa la ni ci dgar btung ngo //
analyzed: nad gzhi mnyam pa la ni ci dgar btung ngo //
translated: For those with a balanced constitution, let them drink as they wish.

original: de la gzhan yang myos pa'am brgyal ba'i nad la ni rlung dang mkhris pa 'joms pa'i sman gtang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan yang myos pa'am brgyal ba'i nad la ni rlung dang mkhris pa 'joms pa'i sman gtang bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, for the illness of intoxication or fainting, give medicine that subdues wind and bile.

original: de la brgyal ba la ni nad gzhi gang las gyur pa brtag ste /
analyzed: de la brgyal ba la ni nad gzhi gang las gyur pa brtag ste /
translated: For fainting, examine what the illness is from.

original: khyad par du mkhris pa brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du mkhris pa brtag par bya'o //
translated: In particular, examine the bile.

original: brgyal ba dang myos pa thams cad la ni bsil ba'i byug pas bsku zhing nor bu chu nang du bcug pa'i chus gtor te rlung yab kyis g-yab po /
analyzed: brgyal ba dang myos pa thams cad la ni bsil ba'i byug pas bsku zhing nor bu chu nang du bcug pa'i chus gtor te rlung yab kyis g-yab po /
translated: For all fainting and intoxication, apply cooling ointments, sprinkle water in which a jewel has been placed, and fan them with a yak-tail fan.

original: rgun 'brum dang / bu ram shing dang ; 'bra go dang / tang pal dang / 'di rnams kyi khu ba 'o ma dang bskol ba kha ras btab pa blud do //
analyzed: rgun 'brum dang / bu ram shing dang ; 'bra go dang / tang pal dang / 'di rnams kyi khu ba 'o ma dang bskol ba kha ras btab pa blud do //
translated: The juice of grapes, sugarcane, jujube, pomegranate, and so forth, mixed with milk and boiled, should be given to drink with a cloth strainer.

original: yang na mngar ba'i sde tshan 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol ba btung ba'am /
analyzed: yang na mngar ba'i sde tshan 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol ba btung ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, a group of sweet substances should be boiled with milk and drunk.

original: yang na sha khu'am mungga'i yu sha gang yang rung ba'i se'u 'bru dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na sha khu'am mungga'i yu sha gang yang rung ba'i se'u 'bru dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Or, the juice of any suitable meat broth or the juice of the sprouts of mung beans should be given.

original: bza' ba ni 'bras drug cu ba dang / 'bras dmar po dang / nas las g-yos su bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba ni 'bras drug cu ba dang / 'bras dmar po dang / nas las g-yos su bya'o //
translated: As food, the six types of rice, red rice, and barley should be prepared.

original: gzhan yang sman 'tsho byed kyi sman mar dang / dge ba'i sman mar dang / tig ta chen po'i sman mar dang / srang ba'i sman mar dang / 'di dag gang yang rung ba 'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang sman 'tsho byed kyi sman mar dang / dge ba'i sman mar dang / tig ta chen po'i sman mar dang / srang ba'i sman mar dang / 'di dag gang yang rung ba 'am /
translated: Furthermore, any of the following medicinal butters should be given: Jivaka medicinal butter, Kalyaka medicinal butter, Mahatika medicinal butter, and Sring medicinal butter.

original: yang na tsitra ka 'o ma dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na tsitra ka 'o ma dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, Citraka should be mixed with milk.

original: yang na pi pi ling dang brag zhun yang bcud kyis len gyi cho ga bzhin du sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: yang na pi pi ling dang brag zhun yang bcud kyis len gyi cho ga bzhin du sbyar ba'am /
translated: Or, Pippali and Bhashaka should be prepared according to the Rasayana procedures.

original: yang na 'bras bu gsum mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sha kha ras btab pa'am /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu gsum mar dang sbrang rtsi dang sha kha ras btab pa'am /
translated: Alternatively, one should administer the three fruits, honey, and meat broth,

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba blud na /
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba blud na /
translated: or any of these individually.

original: myos pa dang brgyal ba thams cad zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: myos pa dang brgyal ba thams cad zhi bar byed do //
translated: This will pacify all intoxications and fainting.

original: myos pa dang brgyal ba shugs drag tu zhen pa la ni kha sna'i dbugs 'gags pa'am /

analyzed: nad gzhi cung zad tshabs chung ngur 'khru ba la ni shu dag dang / bong da dkar po bskol ba'am /

original: yang na ldum bu skra bzangs bskol ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ldum bu skra bzangs bskol ba'am /
translated: Alternatively, give a decoction of good hair herb.

original: yang na ba la ka ta dang / dong gra bskol ba'i chu blud do //
analyzed: yang na ba la ka ta dang / dong gra bskol ba'i chu blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one may give a decoction of bala, kataka, and dong-drel.

original: lus nyam chung zhing bkres pa la zas kyi tshod la bab pa lta na thug pa la sogs pa yang ba'i zas sbyin no //
analyzed: lus nyam chung zhing bkres pa la zas kyi tshod la bab pa lta na thug pa la sogs pa yang ba'i zas sbyin no //
translated: If the patient is weak and hungry, one may give a light meal such as porridge.

original: de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pa dag byas na zas yi gar 'ong zhing me'i drod skyed la nyams stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pa dag byas na zas yi gar 'ong zhing me'i drod skyed la nyams stobs 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one follows the above-mentioned procedures, the patient will enjoy his food, his digestive heat will increase, and his strength will improve.

original: de ltar 'khru ba'i nad pa de gang la goms pa'i btung ba la sogs pa des gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'khru ba'i nad pa de gang la goms pa'i btung ba la sogs pa des gso bar bya ste /
translated: The patient who has been treated with purgation should be treated with the drink and so forth to which he is accustomed.

original: de yang dar ba'am /🔽rang skyur ram /
analyzed: de yang dar ba'am / rang skyur ram /
translated: This may be fresh butter,🔽sour butter,🔽porridge,

original: thug pa'am / skyo ma'am /🔽chang ngam / rgun chang ngam /
analyzed: thug pa'am / skyo ma'am / chang ngam / rgun chang ngam /
translated: sour gruel,🔽wine,

original: gang yang rung bas bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung bas bya'o //
translated: or grape wine, whichever is appropriate.

original: de nas thug @212b pa la sogs pa'i bza' ba sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas thug @212b pa la sogs pa'i bza' ba sbyar te /
translated: Then, one may add porridge and so forth to the diet.

original: de yang me drod bskyed pa dang / sman pa dang / 'khru ba gcod pa'i sman pa la na dang / zur pa dkar po dang / 'u su dang / shing kun dang / da trig dang / bal po se'u dang / pa la sha dang /
analyzed: de yang me drod bskyed pa dang / sman pa dang / 'khru ba gcod pa'i sman pa la na dang / zur pa dkar po dang / 'u su dang / shing kun dang / da trig dang / bal po se'u dang / pa la sha dang /
translated: For that, the five roots are ginger, long pepper, white-flowered leadwort, black pepper, and sweet flag; the five leaves are Indian valerian, neem, Indian sarsaparilla, Indian night shade, and palasha;🔽the five fruits are emblic myrobalan, jujube, bael, pomegranate, and rose apple; the five unctuous substances are ghee, oil, molasses, honey, and marrow; and the five astringents are grapes, pomegranate, jujube, emblic myrobalan, and rose apple.

original: spa ma'i 'bras bu dang / zi ra dang ; la la phud dang / bi dha lce myang tsha dang / rtsa ba chung du lnga dang / pa tha dang / 'di rnams bza' ba dang btung ba dang ci rigs par sbyar te bza'o //
analyzed: spa ma'i 'bras bu dang / zi ra dang ; la la phud dang / bi dha lce myang tsha dang / rtsa ba chung du lnga dang / pa tha dang / 'di rnams bza' ba dang btung ba dang ci rigs par sbyar te bza'o //
translated: These should be used as appropriate in food and drink.

original: bad kan dang mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'khru ba la ni sa la parni dang / ba la dang / bil ba dang / krishna parni dang / 'di rnams las gzhi blangs pa'i thug pa'i nang du se'u 'bru skyur po btab ste blud na phan no //
analyzed: bad kan dang mkhris pa shas che ba'i 'khru ba la ni sa la parni dang / ba la dang / bil ba dang / krishna parni dang / 'di rnams las gzhi blangs pa'i thug pa'i nang du se'u 'bru skyur po btab ste blud na phan no //
translated: For diarrhea with excess phlegm and bile, a base of these should be made into a porridge and sour emblic myrobalan added to it and given. This is beneficial.

original: 'khru ba 'gags pa la ni aa ru ra dang / pi pi ling dang / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / bil ba dang / de dag las gzhi blangs pa'i thug pa blud na rlung bde bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'khru ba 'gags pa la ni aa ru ra dang / pi pi ling dang / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / bil ba dang / de dag las gzhi blangs pa'i thug pa blud na rlung bde bar 'byung ngo //
translated: For obstruction of diarrhea, administer Arura, Pipiling, Pipiling root, and Vilwa, or a porridge prepared from these ingredients. This will help the wind to move smoothly.

original: nad gzhi mang po 'khrugs te 'khru ba 'gags pa dang / me'i drod che ba la ni pi pi ling dang / byi dang ga dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i bkru sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: nad gzhi mang po 'khrugs te 'khru ba 'gags pa dang / me'i drod che ba la ni pi pi ling dang / byi dang ga dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i bkru sman gtang ngo //
translated: For diarrhea caused by a combination of many disorders, or for those with high digestive heat, administer a decoction prepared from Pipiling, Jiwaka, and the three myrobalan fruits.

original: de ltar khrus byas pa'i 'og tu rlung 'joms pa dang / me'i drod skyed pa'i sman tsha ba lnga la sogs pa dang sbyar ba'i thug pa blud do //
analyzed: de ltar khrus byas pa'i 'og tu rlung 'joms pa dang / me'i drod skyed pa'i sman tsha ba lnga la sogs pa dang sbyar ba'i thug pa blud do //
translated: After performing purgation in this way, administer a porridge prepared with the five hot medicines and other ingredients that subdue wind and increase digestive heat.

original: ma zhu ba'i 'khru ba smin nas me'i drod skyed de /
analyzed: ma zhu ba'i 'khru ba smin nas me'i drod skyed de /
translated: If the undigested diarrhea has matured and digestive heat has increased,

original: zhu bar 'khru la de yang dang yang du nyung du nyung dur 'byung zhing mkhregs pa dang / dbu ba dang / be'u snabs dang / dri ma dang nad dang bcas par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: zhu bar 'khru la de yang dang yang du nyung du nyung dur 'byung zhing mkhregs pa dang / dbu ba dang / be'u snabs dang / dri ma dang nad dang bcas par 'byung ba'am /
translated: the diarrhea will become digested. It will occur less frequently, in smaller quantities, and will be thick, foamy, slimy, and accompanied by impurities and illness.

original: yang na phyi sa btsir yang mi 'byung ba la ni zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / bca' sga dang bu ram dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: yang na phyi sa btsir yang mi 'byung ba la ni zho dang / 'o ma dang / mar dang / bca' sga dang bu ram dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: If one cannot expel the feces by pressing, one should drink a potion of curd, milk, ghee, ginger, and molasses.

original: yang na rgya shug gi 'bras bu spangs pa bu ram dang til mar du bcas pa bza'o //🔽'khru ba 'byung dka' ste 'gags pa la ni rgya sne'u'i tshod ma la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sha khu mar mang po dang sbyar ba'i nang du zho dang se'u la sogs pa sbyar ba'am yang na ma sha dang / mon sran sde'u dang /
analyzed: yang na rgya shug gi 'bras bu spangs pa bu ram dang til mar du bcas pa bza'o // 'khru ba 'byung dka' ste 'gags pa la ni rgya sne'u'i tshod ma la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du sha khu mar mang po dang sbyar ba'i nang du zho dang se'u la sogs pa sbyar ba'am yang na ma sha dang / mon sran sde'u dang /
translated: Or one should eat jujube fruit, molasses, and sesame oil.🔽If one has difficulty expelling or retaining urine, one should eat a dish of radish greens, and so forth, or a dish of meat broth with plenty of ghee, curd, and tamarind.

original: til mar dang legs par sbyar ba gang yang rung ba dang / 'bras chan du byas pa bza'o //
analyzed: til mar dang legs par sbyar ba gang yang rung ba dang / 'bras chan du byas pa bza'o //
translated: Or one should eat rice with any of the following: mung beans, black gram, sesame oil, and molasses.

original: @213a * // yang na zur pa dang / aa mu la dang / ka po ti dang / pa tha dang / sva sti ka'i tshod ma'am /
analyzed: @213a * // yang na zur pa dang / aa mu la dang / ka po ti dang / pa tha dang / sva sti ka'i tshod ma'am /
translated: Or one should eat a dish of radish, amulā, kapotī, pāṭhā, and svāti,

original: yang na shu sha dang / la la phud dang / ka ra ta dang / kashi ri ni dang / tsir bi da'i tshod ma'am yang na au po da ka dang / dzi ban ti dang / ba ku dzi dang / rgya sne'u'i tshod ma'am /🔽yang na lcam pa dang / ae randa dang / lo na ki dang / 'di rnams kyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba zho dang legs par sbyar ba dang / 'bras chan bza' ba dang / yang na rus sbal dang / bye'u bar ta ka dang /
analyzed: yang na shu sha dang / la la phud dang / ka ra ta dang / kashi ri ni dang / tsir bi da'i tshod ma'am yang na au po da ka dang / dzi ban ti dang / ba ku dzi dang / rgya sne'u'i tshod ma'am / yang na lcam pa dang / ae randa dang / lo na ki dang / 'di rnams kyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba zho dang legs par sbyar ba dang / 'bras chan bza' ba dang / yang na rus sbal dang / bye'u bar ta ka dang /
translated: Or, one should give a dish of asparagus, or of the three myrobalans, or of sugar cane, or of kshirini, or of chivdi, or of upodaka, or of jivanti, or of bakula, or of new rice.🔽Or, one should give a dish of any of these vegetables, well mixed with curd, with boiled rice, or with the soup of any of these meats: tortoise, partridge,

original: spar ba dang / rma bya dang / sreg pa dang / khyim bya gang yang rung ba'i sha khu dang bcas pa'i bza' ba sbyin no //
analyzed: spar ba dang / rma bya dang / sreg pa dang / khyim bya gang yang rung ba'i sha khu dang bcas pa'i bza' ba sbyin no //
translated: hare, peacock, partridge, or chicken.

original: bil ba dang / gla sgang dang / ba ru ra dang / da ta ka'i me tog dang / dong gra dang 'di rnams dar ba dang sbyar ba'i thug pa 'thungs na zhu ba'i 'khru ba sel to //
analyzed: bil ba dang / gla sgang dang / ba ru ra dang / da ta ka'i me tog dang / dong gra dang 'di rnams dar ba dang sbyar ba'i thug pa 'thungs na zhu ba'i 'khru ba sel to //
translated: One should drink a gruel of bilva, ginger, long pepper, dhataki flower, and coriander, mixed with ghee, to cure dysentery.

original: ka pid ta dang / ka tsu ra dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba dang / yu ti ka dang / n+ya gro dha'i myu gu dang / se'u 'bru dang / sha na'i ras bal dang / sha ma li dang / de rnams kyi lo ma btags pa /
analyzed: ka pid ta dang / ka tsu ra dang / ga bra'i rtsa ba dang / yu ti ka dang / n+ya gro dha'i myu gu dang / se'u 'bru dang / sha na'i ras bal dang / sha ma li dang / de rnams kyi lo ma btags pa /
translated: kapidatta, kacura, the root of gavaksha, yutika, the sprout of nyagrodha, cherry, cotton, and shamalika.

original: zho dang sbyar ba 'thungs na yang zhu ba'i 'khru ba sel to //
analyzed: zho dang sbyar ba 'thungs na yang zhu ba'i 'khru ba sel to //
translated: If one drinks these leaves mixed with curd, it also cures loose stools with digestion.

original: bil ba gzhon nu ma smin pa dang / til zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma dang / zho'i spris ma dang / skyur dang snum dang bcas par til gyi tshigs ma zos na 'khru ba mkhregs pa dang bcas pa zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bil ba gzhon nu ma smin pa dang / til zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma dang / zho'i spris ma dang / skyur dang snum dang bcas par til gyi tshigs ma zos na 'khru ba mkhregs pa dang bcas pa zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats unripe young bilva fruit, sesame flour, curd cream, sour and oily sesame oil cake, it will alleviate hard stools with loose stools.

original: yang na na le sham dang / 'u su dang / zi ra dang / da trig dang / zur pa dkar po dang / lan tshva bi da dang / se'u 'bru dang / da ta ki dang / pa tha dang / 'bras bu gsum dang /
analyzed: yang na na le sham dang / 'u su dang / zi ra dang / da trig dang / zur pa dkar po dang / lan tshva bi da dang / se'u 'bru dang / da ta ki dang / pa tha dang / 'bras bu gsum dang /
translated: Alternatively, one should take long pepper, ushira, jiraka, datrim, white surpa, salt, cherry, dataki, patha, the three fruits,

original: tshab lnga dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / ka pid ta dang / aa mra dang / shing 'dzam bu'i 'bras bu dang / 'di gsum gyi rkang dang / la la phud dang / na le sham gyi drug 'gyur gyi bil ba dang /
analyzed: tshab lnga dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / ka pid ta dang / aa mra dang / shing 'dzam bu'i 'bras bu dang / 'di gsum gyi rkang dang / la la phud dang / na le sham gyi drug 'gyur gyi bil ba dang /
translated: and bilva, which is six times the quantity of cardamom.🔽The oil is a mixture of the fine powder of these ingredients, mung bean soup, molasses, sesame, and butter.

original: 'di rnams zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma zho dang sran mungga'i khu ba dang / bu ram dang til dang mar bsres pa'i snum dang / de rnams tshul bzhin du sbyar ba ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i zas zhes bya ste de las ran par zos na me'i drod skyed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di rnams zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma zho dang sran mungga'i khu ba dang / bu ram dang til dang mar bsres pa'i snum dang / de rnams tshul bzhin du sbyar ba ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i zas zhes bya ste de las ran par zos na me'i drod skyed pa dang /
translated: The proper combination of these is called the food that conquers others. If you eat the right amount of this, it will increase the heat of the digestive fire,

original: zas @213b 'ju ba dang / 'khru ba thur du 'byung ba sra bar byed pa dang / zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang mkhregs pa rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: zas @213b 'ju ba dang / 'khru ba thur du 'byung ba sra bar byed pa dang / zas yi gar mi 'ong ba dang mkhregs pa rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: aid digestion, make downward-moving winds firm, and overcome distaste for food and constipation.

original: yang na rgya shug gi 'bras bu dang / bil ba gzhon nu btags pa dang / 'bras dang / nas dang / mungga dang / mon sran sde'u dang / til dang 'di rnams lhan cig pa de'i nang du til mar dang mar brngos te bcug la zho dang se'u 'bru'i khu ba dang bsres pa tshul bzhin bskol ba ni khu bcud ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rgya shug gi 'bras bu dang / bil ba gzhon nu btags pa dang / 'bras dang / nas dang / mungga dang / mon sran sde'u dang / til dang 'di rnams lhan cig pa de'i nang du til mar dang mar brngos te bcug la zho dang se'u 'bru'i khu ba dang bsres pa tshul bzhin bskol ba ni khu bcud ces bya ste /
translated: Or, mix sesame oil and butter with sesame seeds, young bilva fruit, rice, barley, mung beans, lentils, and sesame seeds, and cook them together with curd and pomegranate juice.

original: de las ran par 'bras chan dang bcas par zos na rtug pa zad cing gdong skams pa la phan no //🔽yang na zho'i spris ma dang / mar dang til mar bsres pa bskol ba'i nang du dong gra'i phye ma bu ram dang sbyar ba bza'o //🔽yang na chang gi nang du til mar dang / mar bskol ba blugs te tshod mar bya'o //
analyzed: de las ran par 'bras chan dang bcas par zos na rtug pa zad cing gdong skams pa la phan no // yang na zho'i spris ma dang / mar dang til mar bsres pa bskol ba'i nang du dong gra'i phye ma bu ram dang sbyar ba bza'o // yang na chang gi nang du til mar dang / mar bskol ba blugs te tshod mar bya'o //
translated: This is called “nutrient soup.” If one eats it in moderation with rice, it eliminates constipation and is good for a dry face.🔽Or, cook curd cream mixed with sesame oil and butter, and eat it with molasses mixed with rice powder.🔽Or, pour sesame oil and butter into beer, and use it as a side dish.

original: yang na ki'u'i khu ba se'u 'bru la sogs pa skyur ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na ki'u'i khu ba se'u 'bru la sogs pa skyur ba dang sbyar te /
translated: Or, mix pomegranate juice with sour substances such as kiu juice.

original: mar dang bskol la bcug pa tshod mar spyar ro //
analyzed: mar dang bskol la bcug pa tshod mar spyar ro //
translated: Mix it with ghee and cook it. Serve it with vegetables.

original: yang na phye'i zan brul gyi steng du mar dang til mar blugs la tsha ba gsum gyi phye mas btab pa bza'o //
analyzed: yang na phye'i zan brul gyi steng du mar dang til mar blugs la tsha ba gsum gyi phye mas btab pa bza'o //
translated: Or, pour ghee and sesame oil on top of a mixture of flour and water, and sprinkle it with the powder of the three hot herbs.

original: yang na sran ma sha legs par sbyar ba'i steng du mar gyi nying khu blugs la zos na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //🔽ra dang lug gi sha khu se'u'i skyur gyi nying khu dang 'u su dang dong gra'i phye ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba bskol te btsags pa'i khu ba 'bras dmar po'i chan dang lhan cig bza' zhing de'i 'og tu btung ba legs par sbyar na rtug pa 'gags
analyzed: yang na sran ma sha legs par sbyar ba'i steng du mar gyi nying khu blugs la zos na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o // ra dang lug gi sha khu se'u'i skyur gyi nying khu dang 'u su dang dong gra'i phye ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba bskol te btsags pa'i khu ba 'bras dmar po'i chan dang lhan cig bza' zhing de'i 'og tu btung ba legs par sbyar na rtug pa 'gags
translated: Or, pour a broth of ghee on top of a mixture of mung beans and meat. The benefits are the same as above.

original: pa myur du zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: pa myur du zhi bar byed do //
translated: Boil a broth of goat or sheep meat with the juice of tamarind, and a mixture of cumin and coriander. Strain the broth and eat it with red rice. If you drink a well-prepared beverage after that, it will quickly relieve the pain of a stopped bowel movement.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: bil ba gzhon nu dang / bu ram dang / til mar dang / pi pi ling dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams kyi lde gu zos na rlung gis 'gags pa dang / zug gzer che zhing mkhregs pa dang bcas pa zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: bil ba gzhon nu dang / bu ram dang / til mar dang / pi pi ling dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams kyi lde gu zos na rlung gis 'gags pa dang / zug gzer che zhing mkhregs pa dang bcas pa zhi bar byed do //
translated: A decoction of tender bilva, jaggery, sesame oil, pippali, and ginger alleviates wind-obstructed, painful, and hard constipation.

original: seng phrom dkar po'i shun pa dang / da ta ki'i me tog dang ; rgya shug gi lo ma dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma zho'i spris ma sbrang rtsi dang ka pid ta'i rang gi khu ba dang lhan cig sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: seng phrom dkar po'i shun pa dang / da ta ki'i me tog dang ; rgya shug gi lo ma dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma zho'i spris ma sbrang rtsi dang ka pid ta'i rang gi khu ba dang lhan cig sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no //
translated: A powder of white sengphrom bark, dataki flowers, and jujube leaves, taken with curd cream, honey, and the juice of its own kapidanta, is beneficial.

original: rlung gis rtug pa 'gags shing zug gzer che ste mkhregs la khrag dang be'u snabs dang bcas par 'byung ba dang / @214a * //
analyzed: rlung gis rtug pa 'gags shing zug gzer che ste mkhregs la khrag dang be'u snabs dang bcas par 'byung ba dang / @214a * //
translated: When wind obstructs feces, causing severe pain, hardness, and discharge of blood and mucus,

original: skom pas gdungs pa la ni 'o ma tshim tshad du sbyin no //
analyzed: skom pas gdungs pa la ni 'o ma tshim tshad du sbyin no //
translated: and when one is tormented by thirst, give milk to one's satisfaction.

original: yang na til dang mar bsres pa'i steng du 'o ma bzhos te lhan cig blud do //
analyzed: yang na til dang mar bsres pa'i steng du 'o ma bzhos te lhan cig blud do //
translated: Alternatively, churn milk on top of a mixture of sesame and butter and give it together.

original: yang na aeranda'i rtsa ba'am ba la'i rtsa ba dang bil ba'i rtsa ba gang yang rung ba dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na aeranda'i rtsa ba'am ba la'i rtsa ba dang bil ba'i rtsa ba gang yang rung ba dang bskol ba'i khu ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one should give a decoction boiled with any of the roots of eranda, bael, or bilva.

original: yang na gla sgang nyi shu dang ; de'i sum 'gyur gyi chu dang / 'o ma srang bzhi dang lhan cig bskol la bzhi cha lus pa las ran par 'thungs na ma zhu ba'i nad dang bcas pa la phan no //
analyzed: yang na gla sgang nyi shu dang ; de'i sum 'gyur gyi chu dang / 'o ma srang bzhi dang lhan cig bskol la bzhi cha lus pa las ran par 'thungs na ma zhu ba'i nad dang bcas pa la phan no //
translated: Alternatively, one should boil twenty grams of ginger, three times that amount of water, and four ounces of milk together, and drink it lukewarm in the appropriate amount. This is beneficial for indigestion and related illnesses.

original: yang na pi pi ling dang na le sham zhib tu btags te 'o ma dang lhan cig 'thungs na yun ring po nas zhen pa'i mkhregs pa yang 'joms so //
analyzed: yang na pi pi ling dang na le sham zhib tu btags te 'o ma dang lhan cig 'thungs na yun ring po nas zhen pa'i mkhregs pa yang 'joms so //
translated: Alternatively, if one grinds pippali and dry ginger finely and drinks it with milk, it will destroy even long-standing hard constipation.

original: smyung ba la sogs bas lus nyam chung zhing khong rtsub la zug gzer gyis nyam thag par gyur na me'i drod brtags te thal sman rnon po mar dang bcas pa sbyin no //
analyzed: smyung ba la sogs bas lus nyam chung zhing khong rtsub la zug gzer gyis nyam thag par gyur na me'i drod brtags te thal sman rnon po mar dang bcas pa sbyin no //
translated: If the body becomes weak, rough, and tormented by pain due to fasting and so on, one should examine the heat of the fire and give sharp purgatives with ghee.

original: yang na rtsa ba bcu pa tshul bzhin du bskol te bzhi cha lus pa dang tshigs ma bor te sman gyi khu ba'i bzhi cha'i mar dang zho dang / chang gi nying khu dang / lce myang tshva dang / tsha ba lnga btags te lhan cig bskol la mar nyi tshe lus pa dang /
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba bcu pa tshul bzhin du bskol te bzhi cha lus pa dang tshigs ma bor te sman gyi khu ba'i bzhi cha'i mar dang zho dang / chang gi nying khu dang / lce myang tshva dang / tsha ba lnga btags te lhan cig bskol la mar nyi tshe lus pa dang /
translated: Alternatively, boil the ten roots properly and discard one quarter of the liquid and the scum. Add to the remaining three quarters of the medicinal liquid, butter, curd, the essence of beer, salt, and the five hot medicines. Boil them together until only a little butter remains.

original: de las ran par zos na gzer bas nyam thag pa sel to //
analyzed: de las ran par zos na gzer bas nyam thag pa sel to //
translated: If one eats a suitable amount of this, it will cure the pain of colic.

translated: Alternatively, prepare a paste of ushira, white sugar, ginger, licorice, ziri, the five hot herbs, and gooseberry, and mix it with a sour Indian myrobalan powder, the juice of citron,

analyzed: da ri ga bri ti'i shun pa btags pa chu dang gong bur byas la kad pa la'i lo ma'i nang du thum por byas te 'jim pas g-yogs la me'i nang du bsregs te phyir phyung la khu ba btsir ba'i khu ba'i nang du sha kha ra'am sbrang rtsi
translated: then the bark of daruharidra should be made into a paste with water and wrapped in kadali leaves. It should be covered with clay and burned in a fire. After removing it, the juice should be squeezed out and mixed with honey or molasses.

analyzed: yang na 'khri shing gi shun pa chu dron dang sbyar la mar dang sbrang rtsi dang bcas pa zos na /

analyzed: 'khru ba tshabs che ba yang zhi bar byed do //

translated: If the hemorrhoids are burned, administer a decoction of madder, lotus,

analyzed: gzhang kha tsha bas tshos pa la ni sman grang ba'i nus pa dang ldan pas bsku ba byas na phan no //
