analyzed: ji ltar shing med pa dang / shing mangs pas me cher mi 'bar ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as fire does not burn greatly due to the absence of wood or an abundance of wood.

original: gang gi tshe bad kan bri ste mkhris pa rang gi gnas su rlung dang lhan cig gnas pas drod skyed pa de'i tshe me dang rlung 'dres pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bad kan bri ste mkhris pa rang gi gnas su rlung dang lhan cig gnas pas drod skyed pa de'i tshe me dang rlung 'dres pa yin te /
translated: When phlegm decreases and bile abides in its own place along with wind, it produces heat. At that time, fire and wind are mixed.

original: des na dang po kha zas myur du 'ju bar byas nas /
analyzed: des na dang po kha zas myur du 'ju bar byas nas /
translated: Therefore, first, food is quickly digested.

original: de'i 'og tu khams dang mdangs thams cad bsregs btsos nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khams dang mdangs thams cad bsregs btsos nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after all the elements and vital essences are burned and cooked, death occurs.

original: skyes bu de'i nad khong na yod kyi bar du tha mal pa yin na yang de ma thag par 'ju ste /
analyzed: skyes bu de'i nad khong na yod kyi bar du tha mal pa yin na yang de ma thag par 'ju ste /
translated: Even if a person is healthy, as long as the disease is internal, it is immediately digested.

original: de nas khams rnams la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas khams rnams la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the elements enter.

original: me drod shin tu che ba las skom dad dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / tsha ba dang / brgyal bar byed pa'i nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me drod shin tu che ba las skom dad dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / tsha ba dang / brgyal bar byed pa'i nad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From excessive heat, thirst, dyspnea, fever, and fainting occur.

original: me'i drod che ba de lta bu la ni /
analyzed: me'i drod che ba de lta bu la ni /
translated: For such excessive heat,

original: kha @223b zas lci ba dang / snum pa dang / bska ba dang / smin skyen pa'i zas dang / grang ba dang / brtan pa la sogs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas zhi bar bya ba ni chus me bsad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: kha @223b zas lci ba dang / snum pa dang / bska ba dang / smin skyen pa'i zas dang / grang ba dang / brtan pa la sogs pa'i bza' ba dang btung bas zhi bar bya ba ni chus me bsad pa bzhin no //
translated: food that is heavy, oily, astringent, ripening, cold, firm, and so on, should be pacified by eating and drinking, like extinguishing fire with water.

original: kha zas ma zhur zin kyang kha zas yang dang yang du bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: kha zas ma zhur zin kyang kha zas yang dang yang du bza' bar bya ste /
translated: Even if food is not digested, food should be eaten again and again.

original: kha zas ma zos na nang gi me'i bud shing med pas khams la gnod de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽me'i stobs ches pa'i skyes bu la ni til dang mon sran sde'u la sogs pa las byas pa'i sa ra'i thug pa dang / 'o thug dang tshil dang zhag la sogs pa'i snum dang / nas thug bu ram dang sbyar ba'i thug pa dang / srog chags chu la gnas pa rus sbal la sogs pa dang ;
analyzed: kha zas ma zos na nang gi me'i bud shing med pas khams la gnod de 'chi bar 'gyur ro // me'i stobs ches pa'i skyes bu la ni til dang mon sran sde'u la sogs pa las byas pa'i sa ra'i thug pa dang / 'o thug dang tshil dang zhag la sogs pa'i snum dang / nas thug bu ram dang sbyar ba'i thug pa dang / srog chags chu la gnas pa rus sbal la sogs pa dang ;
translated: If one does not eat, the internal fire will lack fuel, and the elements will be harmed, leading to death.🔽For a person whose digestive fire is too strong, one should eat porridge made from sesame, mung beans, etc.,🔽and oils made from sesame, beans, etc., porridge made from barley mixed with molasses, and the flesh of animals living in water such as turtles, etc.,

original: chu 'gram na gnas pa'i ngang pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi sha mar la brngos pa dang / khyad par du nya'i sha 'jam po chu mi g-yo ba la gnas pa dang / lug sha legs par brngos pa zos na me'i drod skyed do //
analyzed: chu 'gram na gnas pa'i ngang pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi sha mar la brngos pa dang / khyad par du nya'i sha 'jam po chu mi g-yo ba la gnas pa dang / lug sha legs par brngos pa zos na me'i drod skyed do //
translated: and of those living on the banks of water such as geese, etc., cooked in butter. In particular, if one eats soft fish living in still water and well-cooked mutton, it increases the digestive heat.

original: des kyang ma zhi na 'o ma spra tshil dang sbyar ba'am /
analyzed: des kyang ma zhi na 'o ma spra tshil dang sbyar ba'am /
translated: If that does not pacify it, one should drink milk mixed with beeswax,

original: yang na mar dang spra tshil du sbyar ba skom du blud do //
analyzed: yang na mar dang spra tshil du sbyar ba skom du blud do //
translated: or ghee mixed with beeswax as a drink.

original: bag phye dang mar dang 'o ma sbyar ba'i skom mang du blud do //🔽yang na bag phye srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha khu dang til mar sbangs pa'i snum gang yang rung ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: bag phye dang mar dang 'o ma sbyar ba'i skom mang du blud do // yang na bag phye srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha khu dang til mar sbangs pa'i snum gang yang rung ba dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Give him plenty of drinks mixed with flour, ghee and milk.🔽Or give him a drink mixed with flour, the meat broth of animals living in dry areas, and any of the oils soaked in sesame oil.

original: yang na sha ma dur byid 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i bkru sman gtang ngo //
analyzed: yang na sha ma dur byid 'o ma dang sbyar ba'i bkru sman gtang ngo //
translated: Or give him a decoction of meat, durva grass, and milk.

original: lan mang du mkhris pa sel ba'i sman btang la /
analyzed: lan mang du mkhris pa sel ba'i sman btang la /
translated: Then give him medicine to eliminate bile many times.

original: de'i 'og tu 'o ma dang bcas pa'i zas bza'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'o ma dang bcas pa'i zas bza'o //
translated: After that, he should eat food with milk.

original: kha zas lcib dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bad kan slong bar byed pa'i zas dang zas zos pa'i 'og tu nyin par nyal bar byed pas kyang pho ba'i drod 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: kha zas lcib dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bad kan slong bar byed pa'i zas dang zas zos pa'i 'og tu nyin par nyal bar byed pas kyang pho ba'i drod 'joms par byed do //
translated: Also, the heat of the stomach is destroyed by eating heavy food, unclean food, and food that increases phlegm, and by sleeping during the day after eating.

original: pho ba'i drod shas che na kha zas sreg par byed la /
analyzed: pho ba'i drod shas che na kha zas sreg par byed la /
translated: If the heat of the stomach is strong, it burns the food.

original: de nas nad gzhi dang / khams dang / srog rnams rim bzhin du bsregs nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas nad gzhi dang / khams dang / srog rnams rim bzhin du bsregs nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, the disease, humors, and life are burned in order and he dies.

original: de ltar zas lci ba la sogs pa de dag ni rang bzhin gyis mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zas lci ba la sogs pa de dag ni rang bzhin gyis mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these foods such as heavy ones are naturally incompatible.

original: yang sbyor ba'i dbang gis shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sbyor ba'i dbang gis shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood through the power of application.

original: ci 'dod pa bzhin du mi rung ste /
analyzed: ci 'dod pa bzhin du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to do as one wishes.

original: de bas na mi rnams kyi stobs me las 'byung la /
analyzed: de bas na mi rnams kyi stobs me las 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, the strength of humans arises from fire.

original: stobs las ni srog grub pa de bas na me'i drod skyed cing me drod ran par bya ba la 'bad cing bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: stobs las ni srog grub pa de bas na me'i drod skyed cing me drod ran par bya ba la 'bad cing bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Since strength establishes life, one should strive to generate the heat of fire and maintain the proper heat of fire.

original: de lta bas na me drod nyams na ni mi'i srog kyang nyams par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na me drod nyams na ni mi'i srog kyang nyams par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, if the heat of fire diminishes, the life of humans will also diminish.

original: me drod che chung du song na ni nad sna tshogs kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: me drod che chung du song na ni nad sna tshogs kyang 'byung la /
translated: If the heat of fire increases or decreases, various diseases will also arise.

original: me drod ma nyams na ni nad med cing tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //🔽gso ba'i gnas las pho ba'i nad gso ba'i le'u bcu pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: me drod ma nyams na ni nad med cing tshe ring bar 'gyur ro // gso ba'i gnas las pho ba'i nad gso ba'i le'u bcu pa rdzogs so /
translated: If the heat of fire does not diminish, one will be free from disease and have a long life.🔽Here is the tenth chapter on the treatment of stomach diseases from the Science of Life.

original: // / @224a * //  de nas gcin 'gags pa'i nad gso ba'i le 'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: // / @224a * //  de nas gcin 'gags pa'i nad gso ba'i le 'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of urinary obstruction will be explained.

original: de la rlung las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni /
analyzed: de la rlung las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni /
translated: For a condition of urinary retention due to vata,

original: rlung 'joms pa'i sman til mar dang sbyar bas lte ba'i 'og man chad du bsku byug bya ste /
analyzed: rlung 'joms pa'i sman til mar dang sbyar bas lte ba'i 'og man chad du bsku byug bya ste /
translated: apply an ointment of oil and sesame oil, which are medicines that conquer vata, below the navel.

original: snum dang ldan pa'i dugs dang / blugs pa'i dugs dang byug pa rnams bya'o //
analyzed: snum dang ldan pa'i dugs dang / blugs pa'i dugs dang byug pa rnams bya'o //
translated: Perform a steam bath with oil, a poured steam bath, and an ointment.

original: rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba la dang / ae randa dang / nas dang / nye'u shing dang / ba spru ba dang / rgya sran dang / rgya shug dang / lcags dang / ba spru ba me tog dmar po can dang / sru sru'i rtsa ba dang /
analyzed: rtsa ba bcu pa dang / ba la dang / ae randa dang / nas dang / nye'u shing dang / ba spru ba dang / rgya sran dang / rgya shug dang / lcags dang / ba spru ba me tog dmar po can dang / sru sru'i rtsa ba dang /
translated: The roots of the ten, the five, eranda, barley, radish, white mustard, beans, jujube, iron, red-flowered white mustard, and the root of the sister-in-law,

original: 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma mar dang / phag tshil dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang chu dang tshul bzhin bskol te /
analyzed: 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma mar dang / phag tshil dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang chu dang tshul bzhin bskol te /
translated: grind these into a powder, and boil it with ghee, pig fat, the five salts, and water.

original: btung ba dang / byug pa dang / dugs la sogs pa byas na zug gzer 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: btung ba dang / byug pa dang / dugs la sogs pa byas na zug gzer 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: If one drinks it, applies it, and performs a steam bath, it is the best for conquering pain.

original: yang na gong gi sman de rnams 'bru mar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rigs rnams dang / skyur dang snum mang po dang ldan par btung ba dang / zas dang byug pa la sogs pa byas na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang na gong gi sman de rnams 'bru mar 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rigs rnams dang / skyur dang snum mang po dang ldan par btung ba dang / zas dang byug pa la sogs pa byas na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Alternatively, if the above medicines are taken with oil-seed cakes, sour and oily substances, and used as food, ointments, and so forth, the benefits are the same as above.

original: btung ba ni kha ru tsha mang po dang sbyar ba'i chang 'thungs na gcin 'gags pa sel to //
analyzed: btung ba ni kha ru tsha mang po dang sbyar ba'i chang 'thungs na gcin 'gags pa sel to //
translated: For drinking, if one drinks beer mixed with a lot of salt, it will cure urinary retention.

original: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni bsil bas lus la blugs pa dang / byug pa dang lums bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni bsil bas lus la blugs pa dang / byug pa dang lums bya'o //
translated: For treating urinary retention caused by bile, cool things should be applied to the body, and ointments and compresses should be used.

original: nye'u shing dang gze ma dang / bata  ri dang / rgun 'bru dang / rtsa'i rtsa ba dang / 'di rnams tshul bzhin bskol ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa blud ngo //
analyzed: nye'u shing dang gze ma dang / bata  ri dang / rgun 'bru dang / rtsa'i rtsa ba dang / 'di rnams tshul bzhin bskol ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang / sha kha ra btab pa blud ngo //
translated: Take neem, turmeric, tamarind, grapes, and root of rtsa, properly boiled, and add honey and sugar.

original: ba sha ka dang / ga gon dang / aer ba ru dang / le brgan rtsi 'di gsum gyi sa bon dang / gur kum dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma rgun chu dang sbyar ba 'thungs na gcin 'gags pa'i nad thams cad sel to //
analyzed: ba sha ka dang / ga gon dang / aer ba ru dang / le brgan rtsi 'di gsum gyi sa bon dang / gur kum dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma rgun chu dang sbyar ba 'thungs na gcin 'gags pa'i nad thams cad sel to //
translated: The seeds of vāsā, gokṣura, and erabaru, and the powders of these three, when drunk with grape juice, cure all diseases of urinary retention.

original: yang na rgyal mo ga gon gyi sa bon dang shing mngar dang / skyer pa'i phye ma dang 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang 'thungs na yang phan no //
analyzed: yang na rgyal mo ga gon gyi sa bon dang shing mngar dang / skyer pa'i phye ma dang 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang 'thungs na yang phan no //
translated: Alternatively, the seeds of rājaprāyā, madhuka, and kṛṣṇagnir, and the water in which rice has been washed, when drunk, are also beneficial.

original: yang na rgun 'brum cham chom brdungs nas chu dang sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no //
analyzed: yang na rgun 'brum cham chom brdungs nas chu dang sbyar ba 'thungs na phan no //
translated: Alternatively, drinking raisins that have been crushed and mixed with water is helpful.

original: bad kan las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni thog mar dugs byas la de'i 'og tu rno ba dang / dro ba dang / tsha ba'i skyug sman btang ngo //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni thog mar dugs byas la de'i 'og tu rno ba dang / dro ba dang / tsha ba'i skyug sman btang ngo //
translated: For diseases of urinary retention caused by phlegm, first apply fomentation, and then administer sharp, hot, and pungent emetics.

original: bza' ba ni nas las byas pa'i zan dang / khur ba la @224b sogs pa rno ba dang / tsha ba dang / nas tshigs 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / dar ba dang bcas pa sbyin no //🔽btung ba ni sug smel lam /
analyzed: bza' ba ni nas las byas pa'i zan dang / khur ba la @224b sogs pa rno ba dang / tsha ba dang / nas tshigs 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / dar ba dang bcas pa sbyin no // btung ba ni sug smel lam /
translated: For food, give barley-meal cakes, pastries, etc., that are sharp, hot, and mixed with the ashes of burnt barley husks and buttermilk.

original: skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba dang chang du sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu gang yang rung ba dang chang du sbyar ba blud do //
translated: For drink, give a decoction of long pepper or emblic myrobalan fruit mixed with alcohol.

original: yang na bya bzhad kyi rus pa dang / gze ma dang / sug smel dang / tsha ba gsum dang / 'di rnams sbrang rtsi dang ba gcin dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
analyzed: yang na bya bzhad kyi rus pa dang / gze ma dang / sug smel dang / tsha ba gsum dang / 'di rnams sbrang rtsi dang ba gcin dang sbyar ba btung ngo //
translated: Or give a drink of the bones of a partridge, ginger, long pepper, and the three hot medicines, mixed with honey and cow’s urine.

original: yang na kanda ka ri bskol ba'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na kanda ka ri bskol ba'i khu ba sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Or give a drink of a decoction of boiled Kaṇṭakī, mixed with honey.

original: yang na shing ti pa ra ga'i sa bon zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma dang dar ba bskyos te blud do //
analyzed: yang na shing ti pa ra ga'i sa bon zhib tu btags pa'i phye ma dang dar ba bskyos te blud do //
translated: Or give a drink of a fine powder of the seeds of the tilaka tree, mixed with buttermilk and churned.

original: yang na dha ba dang / sab ta parni dang / dug mo yungs dang / sle tres dang / dong ga dang / ke'u ka dang / sug smel dang / she ta ka ranydza dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'am yang na de rnams sbyar ba'i thug pa blud do //
analyzed: yang na dha ba dang / sab ta parni dang / dug mo yungs dang / sle tres dang / dong ga dang / ke'u ka dang / sug smel dang / she ta ka ranydza dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du sbrang rtsi dang sbyar ba 'am yang na de rnams sbyar ba'i thug pa blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one should give a drink of the decoction of dhava, sabariparni, black aconite, long pepper, ginger, turmeric, cumin, white teak, and white teak flowers, mixed with honey, or a gruel made from those ingredients.

original: yang na byu ru btags pa'i phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang lhan cig btung ngo //
analyzed: yang na byu ru btags pa'i phye ma 'bras bkrus pa'i chu dang lhan cig btung ngo //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a powder of coral mixed with water in which rice has been washed.

original: yang na shing pa ta la'i thal ba'i chu dang sbyar ba lan bdun btsags pa'i khu ba til mar dang sbyar ba blud do //
analyzed: yang na shing pa ta la'i thal ba'i chu dang sbyar ba lan bdun btsags pa'i khu ba til mar dang sbyar ba blud do //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of seven times filtered ash of palasha wood, mixed with sesame oil.

original: yang na shing pa ta la dang / ya ba ksha ra dang / pa ri pa tra dang / til dang / de rnams kyi thal ba chu dang bskyos pa dang / chang dangs ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i nang du shing tsha dang sug smel dang /
analyzed: yang na shing pa ta la dang / ya ba ksha ra dang / pa ri pa tra dang / til dang / de rnams kyi thal ba chu dang bskyos pa dang / chang dangs ma dang lhan cig sbyar ba'i nang du shing tsha dang sug smel dang /
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of the ashes of palasha, yavakshara, paripatra, and sesame, mixed with water, clear wine, and the powders of white teak and cumin.

original: spangs ma dang / 'di rnams gsum gyi phye mas btab la blud do //
analyzed: spangs ma dang / 'di rnams gsum gyi phye mas btab la blud do //
translated: These three powders should be mixed and administered.

original: gong gi btung ba dang / lde gu'i sman thams cad kyi nang du bu ram bskol te /
analyzed: gong gi btung ba dang / lde gu'i sman thams cad kyi nang du bu ram bskol te /
translated: All the above drinks and medicinal pastes should be prepared by boiling with jaggery.

original: khanda tsam sra bar gyur pa btab la mnyes te sbyin no //
analyzed: khanda tsam sra bar gyur pa btab la mnyes te sbyin no //
translated: When it becomes as hard as khanda, it should be dissolved and given.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni nad gzhi so so'i gso ba dang mthun par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa'i gcin 'gags pa'i nad la ni nad gzhi so so'i gso ba dang mthun par sbyar ro //
translated: For urinary retention caused by accumulation, treatment should be applied according to the individual condition.

original: rde'u yun mi ring du chags pa la yang de ltar nad gzhi so so dang mthun pa'i sman dpyad de rlung nad 'joms pa'i 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba la sogs pa yang de ltar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rde'u yun mi ring du chags pa la yang de ltar nad gzhi so so dang mthun pa'i sman dpyad de rlung nad 'joms pa'i 'jam rtsi mas gtong ba la sogs pa yang de ltar sbyar ro //
translated: For stones that have not been there for a long time, similar medicinal treatments should be applied according to the individual condition, such as administering smooth ointments that conquer wind disorders.

original: rde'u chags pa'i nad ni shin tu mi bzad pa yin te 'chi bdag gi gzugs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rde'u chags pa'i nad ni shin tu mi bzad pa yin te 'chi bdag gi gzugs dang 'dra'o //
translated: The disease of stone formation is extremely severe and resembles the form of the Lord of Death.

original: de yang rde'u nar ma son pa la ni sman gyis gso'o //
analyzed: de yang rde'u nar ma son pa la ni sman gyis gso'o //
translated: Moreover, for immature stones, they should be treated with medicine.

original: nar son pa la ni mtshon gyi las bya ste /
analyzed: nar son pa la ni mtshon gyi las bya ste /
translated: For mature stones, surgical procedures should be performed.

original: de la dang po rde'u ji ltar chags pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas nas snum chos la sogs pa'i rim pa bya bar 'dod de /
analyzed: de la dang po rde'u ji ltar chags pa'i mtshan nyid shes par byas nas snum chos la sogs pa'i rim pa bya bar 'dod de /
translated: First, having understood the characteristics of how the stones form, one should wish to perform the stages of the oil therapy and so forth.

original: sru sru'i rtsa ba dang / ba @225a * //
analyzed: sru sru'i rtsa ba dang / ba @225a * //
translated: The root of the sru,

original: su ka dang / ba si ri dang / aa sman ta dang / nye'u shing dang / lcam pa dang / aa ti ba la dang / go bye dang / pu tse shel dang / ka tsa ka dang / brakshi da ni dang / shing sha ka'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: su ka dang / ba si ri dang / aa sman ta dang / nye'u shing dang / lcam pa dang / aa ti ba la dang / go bye dang / pu tse shel dang / ka tsa ka dang / brakshi da ni dang / shing sha ka'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: vasuka, vasirī, aśmantaka, nyagrodha, champak, atibala, gobye, puce shel, kṣaka, braśidana, śākaki fruit,

translated: If the patient is emaciated and weak, then one should not administer fat and urine, but rather medicines and food that promote physical growth and development.

original: kham phor shar ba lta bu'i nad la sogs pa'i 'brum bu phra mo'i nad bcu 'byung ba'i nad ma smin pa la ni skrangs pa'i gso ba bya la smin pa la ni gso ba'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: kham phor shar ba lta bu'i nad la sogs pa'i 'brum bu phra mo'i nad bcu 'byung ba'i nad ma smin pa la ni skrangs pa'i gso ba bya la smin pa la ni gso ba'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: For the ten types of minor pox, such as those that resemble a broken clay pot, and so on, if the disease is immature, one should treat the swelling, and if mature, one should perform the healing procedure.

original: thog mar nad gzhi brtags te n+ya gro dha la sogs pa shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa bskol ba'i khu ba dang / ra'i 'o ma ni rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: thog mar nad gzhi brtags te n+ya gro dha la sogs pa shing 'o ma can gyi shun pa bskol ba'i khu ba dang / ra'i 'o ma ni rab tu bsngags so //
translated: First, having examined the disease, one should boil the bark of milky trees such as nyagrodha, and the milk of a goat is highly recommended.

original: dang po slon khrus kyis lus ngag par byas te de yang gcin nad la ni rno ba dang rtsub pa'i bkru sman gtong ngo //
analyzed: dang po slon khrus kyis lus ngag par byas te de yang gcin nad la ni rno ba dang rtsub pa'i bkru sman gtong ngo //
translated: First, having cleansed the body with a decoction, one should administer sharp and rough purgatives for urinary diseases.

original: yang @230b na sug smel gyi sde tshan til mar dang sbyar bas rma 'drub par bya zhing dong gra la sogs pa'i sde tshan bskol bas lus dril bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang @230b na sug smel gyi sde tshan til mar dang sbyar bas rma 'drub par bya zhing dong gra la sogs pa'i sde tshan bskol bas lus dril bar bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, one should heal the wound with a sesame oil preparation of the Pippalyadi group, and fumigate the body with a decoction of the Dantidi group.

original: sman aa sa na'i sde tshan bskol ba'i chus bkru zhing blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: sman aa sa na'i sde tshan bskol ba'i chus bkru zhing blugs par bya'o //
translated: One should wash and drink the decoction of the group of medicinal plants of the Asana class.

original: dug mo yungs kyi sde tshan bskol ba ni bza' ba dang btung bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dug mo yungs kyi sde tshan bskol ba ni bza' ba dang btung bar sbyar ro //
translated: The decoction of the group of medicinal plants of the Sinduvari class should be used for food and drink.

original: pa tha dang / kru trug tres dang / sha rang gashtha dang / thal tres dang / kanda ka ri dang / sabta pa rni dug mo yungs kyi rtsa ba dang / kad pa la dang / dong gra dang 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma sbrang rtsi dang lde gur byas te bldag pa dang /
analyzed: pa tha dang / kru trug tres dang / sha rang gashtha dang / thal tres dang / kanda ka ri dang / sabta pa rni dug mo yungs kyi rtsa ba dang / kad pa la dang / dong gra dang 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma sbrang rtsi dang lde gur byas te bldag pa dang /
translated: One should chew the powder of Patha, Kutaja, Shravani, Haritaki, Kantakari, Shataparna, Sinduvari root, Kadali, and Danti, mixed with honey and made into a paste.

original: yang na skya rbab kyi gso ba'i nang nas lcags phye cha dgu pa zhes bya ba'i phye ma dag 'dir sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na skya rbab kyi gso ba'i nang nas lcags phye cha dgu pa zhes bya ba'i phye ma dag 'dir sbyar ro //
translated: Or, the powder called Navayasa, which is mentioned in the treatment of ascites, should be used here.

original: sbrang rtsi lta bu zhes bya ba'i gcin nad na bar gyur na skyes bu rnams kyis yongs su spang bar bya ste 'on kyang brag zhun brgya'i sbyor ba dang / pu na rna'i sbyor ba ni bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi lta bu zhes bya ba'i gcin nad na bar gyur na skyes bu rnams kyis yongs su spang bar bya ste 'on kyang brag zhun brgya'i sbyor ba dang / pu na rna'i sbyor ba ni bya bar bshad do //
translated: It is said that one should completely avoid urine when suffering from a disease of urine, like honey, but the use of mercury and Punarnava is recommended.

original: gso ba'i gnas las gcin snyi ba za gu'i nad gso ba'i le 'u ste bcu gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gso ba'i gnas las gcin snyi ba za gu'i nad gso ba'i le 'u ste bcu gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the twelfth chapter, on the treatment of diabetes, from the Secret Quintessential Instructions on the Eight Branches of the Ayurveda.

original: // / de nas khong 'bras gso ba'i le'u bcu gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas khong 'bras gso ba'i le'u bcu gsum pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Chapter 13: Treatment of Abdominal Distension

original: de la 'bras so cog ma smin pa'i tshe na ni skrangs pa gso ba'i cho ga ltar so so'i rtags dang mthun par gtar ga bya ste khrag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de la 'bras so cog ma smin pa'i tshe na ni skrangs pa gso ba'i cho ga ltar so so'i rtags dang mthun par gtar ga bya ste khrag dbyung ngo //
translated: When any type of abdominal distension is not ripe, venesection should be performed according to the individual signs and symptoms, as in the treatment of swelling, and blood should be let out.

original: smin zin pa la ni dral la rma gso ba'i cho ga ltar bya'o //
analyzed: smin zin pa la ni dral la rma gso ba'i cho ga ltar bya'o //
translated: When it is ripe, it should be treated as in the treatment of wounds.

original: de nas rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rtsa ba lnga dang lan tshva shas che ba dang bskol ba'i chus rma bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rlung las gyur pa'i rma la ni rtsa ba lnga dang lan tshva shas che ba dang bskol ba'i chus rma bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Then, for wounds caused by loong, the wound should be washed with a decoction of the five roots and a large amount of salt.

original: gzhan yang me pa da ru'i sde tshan dang / shing mngar dang lan tshva dang til dang lhan cig sbyar bas rma bkru'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang me pa da ru'i sde tshan dang / shing mngar dang lan tshva dang til dang lhan cig sbyar bas rma bkru'o //
translated: Furthermore, the wound should be washed with a compound of the Mepa da rue medicinal group, sweet wood, salt and sesame seeds.

original: yang na bkru sman gang yang rung ba'i nang du dri bi tsa btab ste snum chen po bzhi gang yang rung ba bsres te blud la khrus byas te lus dag par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bkru sman gang yang rung ba'i nang du dri bi tsa btab ste snum chen po bzhi gang yang rung ba bsres te blud la khrus byas te lus dag par bya'o //
translated: Or else, having added Vibhitaka to any suitable purgative, mix it with any of the four great oils, give it to drink, and bathe, purifying the body.

original: de nas rma 'drub par bya ba'i phyir ba da ri'i sde tshan dang dur byid bsres pas rma bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rma 'drub par bya ba'i phyir ba da ri'i sde tshan dang dur byid bsres pas rma bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to heal the wound, apply a paste of the Vadara group mixed with turmeric.

original: mkhris pa'i rma la ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i 'o ma can gyi shing las byung ba'i 'o mas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa'i rma la ni n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i 'o ma can gyi shing las byung ba'i 'o mas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: For a wound of bile, wash with milk from a tree such as the banyan.

original: de nas shing mngar dang / til dang / aa ru ra 'di gsum gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: de nas shing mngar dang / til dang / aa ru ra 'di gsum gyis bsku'o //
translated: Then apply a paste of these three: sweet flag, sesame, and Haritaki.

original: rma 'drub par bya ba'i phyir btsod dang / pu shel tse dang / shug pa dang / pa ya sya dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / shing mngar @231a * //
analyzed: rma 'drub par bya ba'i phyir btsod dang / pu shel tse dang / shug pa dang / pa ya sya dang / ser po rnam gnyis dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / shing mngar @231a * //
translated: In order to heal the wound, apply a paste of turmeric, Pushkarabi, juniper, Payasa, the two types of Serpi, the three fruits, and sweet flag.

original: 'di rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te 'o ma ni du mar ni lus pa bsku'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams 'o ma dang lhan cig bskol te 'o ma ni du mar ni lus pa bsku'o //
translated: Boil these together with milk, and when the milk has evaporated, apply the paste.

original: yang n+ya gro dha'i sde tshan gyi shing dang / lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang / shun pa dang / mar bskol bas bskus na 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang n+ya gro dha'i sde tshan gyi shing dang / lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang / shun pa dang / mar bskol bas bskus na 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, for a wound caused by a tree of the Nyagrodha group, the wound should be washed with a decoction of leaves, fruits, bark, and oil of that tree.

original: bad kan las gyur pa la ni dong gra'i sde tshan bskol bas rma bkru'o //
analyzed: bad kan las gyur pa la ni dong gra'i sde tshan bskol bas rma bkru'o //
translated: For a wound caused by phlegm, the wound should be washed with a decoction of the group of Danti.

original: de nas phye dang ser po rnam gnyis dang / shing nye rong dang / til mar dang 'di rnams kyis bsku'o //
analyzed: de nas phye dang ser po rnam gnyis dang / shing nye rong dang / til mar dang 'di rnams kyis bsku'o //
translated: Then it should be smeared with a mixture of the two types of powders, yellow myrobalan, Nyagrodha wood, and sesame oil.

original: yang na rgya sran dang / dan da dang / sha ma dur byid dang / kru trug tres dang / seng phrom dkar po dang / rgyam tsha dang / til dang ba gcin dang sbyar bas bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rgya sran dang / dan da dang / sha ma dur byid dang / kru trug tres dang / seng phrom dkar po dang / rgyam tsha dang / til dang ba gcin dang sbyar bas bskus na rma 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, it should be smeared with a mixture of beans, Danda, Shveta, Durva, Kritavedhana, white Sengdeng, Gyamtsa, sesame, and cow's urine. The wound will heal.

original: de bzhin du glo bur du snad pa 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du glo bur du snad pa 'am /
translated: Similarly, for a sudden injury

original: khrag las gyur pa'i 'bras la ni mkhris pa las gyur pa la ji ltar gso pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: khrag las gyur pa'i 'bras la ni mkhris pa las gyur pa la ji ltar gso pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: or a blood-related disease, it should be treated as for a bile-related disease.

original: khong 'bras nang du ma smin pa la ni mar gyi sde tshan bskol ba'i nang du au sha ka'i sde tshan gyi phye mas btab ste bad kan gyi dus las yol ba dang blud par bya'o //
analyzed: khong 'bras nang du ma smin pa la ni mar gyi sde tshan bskol ba'i nang du au sha ka'i sde tshan gyi phye mas btab ste bad kan gyi dus las yol ba dang blud par bya'o //
translated: For unripened abscesses, administer a decoction of the ghee group with a powder of the uśira group after the time of kapha.

original: yang na bkru sman gang yang rung ba mar dang sbyar ba'i nang du gong gi sman sde tshan gnyis kyi phye mas btab pa blud do //
analyzed: yang na bkru sman gang yang rung ba mar dang sbyar ba'i nang du gong gi sman sde tshan gnyis kyi phye mas btab pa blud do //
translated: Alternatively, administer a powder of the two groups above in a decoction of any purgative medicine combined with ghee.

original: yang na nad ma smin pa la ni bkru sman drag po dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtang bar bya ste de yang gong gi sde tshan gnyis las nad gzhi gong dang mthun pa sbyar la mas gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na nad ma smin pa la ni bkru sman drag po dang / 'jam rtsi mas gtang bar bya ste de yang gong gi sde tshan gnyis las nad gzhi gong dang mthun pa sbyar la mas gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Or, for unripened abscesses, administer a strong purgative and an enema. The two groups above should be combined according to the above conditions and administered as an enema.

original: dang por nad ji lta ba bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang na le sham dkar pos btab pa'i bza' ba dang btud ba dang bsku ba byas sam blud na khong 'bras ma smin pa 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: dang por nad ji lta ba bzhin du sbrang rtsi dang na le sham dkar pos btab pa'i bza' ba dang btud ba dang bsku ba byas sam blud na khong 'bras ma smin pa 'joms par byed do //
translated: First, administer food, drink, and massage that is mixed with honey and white long pepper according to the condition. This will destroy unripened abscesses.

original: gzhan yang kyi lce ba dang / shing mngar dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / nim pa dang / pu shel tsi 'di rnams cha snyoms pa dang dri bi ta dang / pa ta la'i rtsa ba 'di gnyis kyi lci ba'i bzhi 'gyur dang / sran chung de'i brgyad 'gyur rnams chu dang mar dang tshul bzhin bskol nas blud na khong 'bras dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang kyi lce ba dang / shing mngar dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / nim pa dang / pu shel tsi 'di rnams cha snyoms pa dang dri bi ta dang / pa ta la'i rtsa ba 'di gnyis kyi lci ba'i bzhi 'gyur dang / sran chung de'i brgyad 'gyur rnams chu dang mar dang tshul bzhin bskol nas blud na khong 'bras dang /
translated: Furthermore, if one drinks a decoction of equal parts of kyi lche, shing ngar, the three fruits, nimpa, and pushhel tsi, two times the quantity of drivita, and eight times the quantity of patala root, boiled together with water and butter, it is beneficial for stomach disorders,

original: skran dang / me dbal dang / lus tshab dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / sa bon mangs pa dang / skom dad che ba dang / brgyal ba dang / slon pa dang / snying na ba dang / khrag mkhris dang / mdze dang /
analyzed: skran dang / me dbal dang / lus tshab dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / sa bon mangs pa dang / skom dad che ba dang / brgyal ba dang / slon pa dang / snying na ba dang / khrag mkhris dang / mdze dang /
translated: tumors, erysipelas, body swellings, memory loss, excessive discharge, excessive thirst, fainting, indigestion, heart pain, blood and bile disorders, leprosy,

original: mig ser gyi nang dang / 'di rnams la phan no //
analyzed: mig ser gyi nang dang / 'di rnams la phan no //
translated: and jaundice.

original: yang na kyi lce ba srang bzhi chu srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bskol @231b te bzhi cha lus pa dang / skyur ba'i khu ba srang bzhi dang / 'o ma srang bzhi dang / mar srang bzhi dang / tig ta dang / tra yan ti dang /
analyzed: yang na kyi lce ba srang bzhi chu srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang bskol @231b te bzhi cha lus pa dang / skyur ba'i khu ba srang bzhi dang / 'o ma srang bzhi dang / mar srang bzhi dang / tig ta dang / tra yan ti dang /
translated: Alternatively, boil four ounces of kyi tshae, thirty-two ounces of water, and one-fourth of the remaining liquid with four ounces of sour gruel, four ounces of milk, four ounces of butter, and tikta, trayanti,

original: byi tsher ba dang / gla sgang dang / ta ma la gi dang / ram nye ba dang / dzi ban ti dang / tsananda dang autpa la dang / 'di rnams zho gnyis cham chom brdungs la gcig tu bskol la mar 'ba' zhig lus pa blud pa 'am /
analyzed: byi tsher ba dang / gla sgang dang / ta ma la gi dang / ram nye ba dang / dzi ban ti dang / tsananda dang autpa la dang / 'di rnams zho gnyis cham chom brdungs la gcig tu bskol la mar 'ba' zhig lus pa blud pa 'am /
translated: bhisha tshae, laagang, tamalaki, ramnyae, jibanti, chandana, utpala. Grind two shho of these into a fine powder, mix them together, and boil them. Administer the remaining butter alone.

original: yang na rgun 'bru 'am /
analyzed: yang na rgun 'bru 'am /
translated: Alternatively, administer a decoction of grapes,

original: ma du ga'i me tog dang / 'bra go dang / bi da ri dang / nye'u shing dang / pa ru sha dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du mar dang 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang /
analyzed: ma du ga'i me tog dang / 'bra go dang / bi da ri dang / nye'u shing dang / pa ru sha dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / 'di rnams bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du mar dang 'o ma dang / bu ram shing gi khu ba dang /
translated: madhuka flowers, radish, vidari, ne’u sing, parusha, and the three fruits, with butter, milk, and sugarcane juice.

original: skyur po dang 'di rnams cha mnyam ste aa ru ra'i phye mas btab nas bskol la mar lus pa dang grang ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang mar gyi bzhi cha dang bsres nas blud na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyur po dang 'di rnams cha mnyam ste aa ru ra'i phye mas btab nas bskol la mar lus pa dang grang ba'i nang du sha kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang mar gyi bzhi cha dang bsres nas blud na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Equal parts of sour and sweet are mixed with powdered myrobalan, boiled, and when only the ghee remains, it is cooled and mixed with sugar, honey, and one-fourth ghee. If given, it should be known to have the same benefits as above.

original: de la nad tshabs che chung dang sbyar bas gar skrangs pa'i steng du rdabs rva dang / ku ba dang / srin bu pad pa dang gsum gyis khrag dbyung ba 'am /
analyzed: de la nad tshabs che chung dang sbyar bas gar skrangs pa'i steng du rdabs rva dang / ku ba dang / srin bu pad pa dang gsum gyis khrag dbyung ba 'am /
translated: Here, according to the severity of the illness, blood should be drawn from the swollen area with the three [instruments] of rab rwa, ku ba, and srin bu pad pa.

original: yang na gtar ga 'di bzhi gang yang rung bas khrag dbyung ngo //
analyzed: yang na gtar ga 'di bzhi gang yang rung bas khrag dbyung ngo //
translated: Or, blood should be drawn with any of these four venesections.

original: de la 'bras che chung 'dra bar smin pa'i mtshan ma ni phyi rol du 'bur bar snang ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras che chung 'dra bar smin pa'i mtshan ma ni phyi rol du 'bur bar snang ste /
translated: The signs of the ripening of large or small pox are externally appearing bumps.

original: de yang phyogs gcig tu 'dus pa dang 'dug ste /
analyzed: de yang phyogs gcig tu 'dus pa dang 'dug ste /
translated: Moreover, they gather and remain in one place.

original: steng du lag pas reg na rab tu na zhing mnan na gshong bar 'dug la lus tsha bar byed de /
analyzed: steng du lag pas reg na rab tu na zhing mnan na gshong bar 'dug la lus tsha bar byed de /
translated: If touched with the hand above, it is very painful and when pressed, it sinks and causes the body to become hot.

original: de la ni gong gi bkru sman gyis byug go //
analyzed: de la ni gong gi bkru sman gyis byug go //
translated: In this case, the above cleansing medicine should be applied.

original: de la 'bras smin pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas mtshon gyis dral te /
analyzed: de la 'bras smin pa'i mtshan ma mthong nas mtshon gyis dral te /
translated: When the signs of ripe abscess are seen, it should be incised with an instrument.

original: rma gso ba'i cho ga bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rma gso ba'i cho ga bstan par bya'o //
translated: The procedure for healing the wound should be taught.

original: khong 'bras nang du smin pa'i mtshan ma yang de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: khong 'bras nang du smin pa'i mtshan ma yang de ltar blta'o //
translated: The signs of internal abscess ripening should be observed in the same way.

original: khong 'bras smin nas gong 'og tu mched par byed de /
analyzed: khong 'bras smin nas gong 'og tu mched par byed de /
translated: After the internal abscess ripens, it spreads up and down.

original: de yang smin nas myur bar dpyad ma byas pa dang / kha zas mi mthun pa zos pa'i nyes pas rma skrangs pa mched cing 'drul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang smin nas myur bar dpyad ma byas pa dang / kha zas mi mthun pa zos pa'i nyes pas rma skrangs pa mched cing 'drul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that ripens and is not quickly treated, due to the fault of eating incompatible food, the swollen wound spreads and bursts.

original: de yang zhag bcu gnyis kyi bar du gong 'og tu mi mched par bya ba'i cho gas bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang zhag bcu gnyis kyi bar du gong 'og tu mi mched par bya ba'i cho gas bsrung bar bya ste /

analyzed: de yang ba ra na la sogs pa'i sde tshan bskol ba'i khu ba dro 'jam tsam mam yang na shi kru dang sbrang rtsi sbyar ba 'am /🔽yang na 'bras kyi thug pa la shi kru dang / sbrang rtsi sbyar ba 'am /

analyzed: yang na nas dang / rgya shug dang / rgya sran @232a * // gyi khu ba btung ba 'am /
translated: Or drink a decoction of barley, jujube, and beans.

original: bza' ba 'am /
analyzed: bza' ba 'am /
translated: Or eat or drink

original: btung ba ni rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: btung ba ni rab tu bsngags so //
translated: the above-mentioned ghee.

original: zhag bcu nas ni /
analyzed: zhag bcu nas ni /
translated: After ten days,

original: kyi lce ba la sogs pa'i mar gong du smos pa 'am /
analyzed: kyi lce ba la sogs pa'i mar gong du smos pa 'am /

translated: Ascites is caused by a predominance of faults and

translated: arises from the channels being blocked.

analyzed: de bas na de la ni yang dang yang du bkru sman gtang bar bya'o //

analyzed: dmu rdzing can gyi nad pa la btung bar ni nyin mtshan du ae randa'i mar ba gcin nam 'o ma dang lhan cig btung ba 'am yang na ba gcin nam ma he'i gcin nyi tshe zla ba gcig gam gnyis kyi bar du sbyin no //
translated: For a patient with ascites, they should drink Eranda oil with cow's urine or milk, or just cow's urine or buffalo urine, for one or two months.

original: lus nyams 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus nyams 'phel zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To increase and expand the body,

original: ba dang rnga mo'i 'o ma nyi tshe zla ba gcig gam gnyis kyi bar du blud do //
analyzed: ba dang rnga mo'i 'o ma nyi tshe zla ba gcig gam gnyis kyi bar du blud do //
translated: they should drink just cow or camel milk for one or two months.

original: khyad par du lus tsha ba dang / lto sbo bas nyam thag pa dang / skom dad che ba dang / brgyal ba zil gyis non pa la yang rnga mo'i 'o ma sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par du lus tsha ba dang / lto sbo bas nyam thag pa dang / skom dad che ba dang / brgyal ba zil gyis non pa la yang rnga mo'i 'o ma sbyar ro //
translated: In particular, for those afflicted with body heat, distended abdomen, intense thirst, and fainting, they should be given camel milk.

original: rtsub cing rlung shas cher g-yo ba las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing gi nad dag par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: rtsub cing rlung shas cher g-yo ba las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing gi nad dag par 'dod na ni /
translated: If one wishes to purify the diseases of dropsy that arise from the rough and windy humors,

analyzed: sman mar dmu rdzing 'joms pa gang yang rung bas snum chos sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: one should apply an oil enema with any of the anti-dropsy medicinal butters.

original: sman mar srang drug pa zhes bya ba rtsa ba bcu pa bskol ba'i chu dang zho ga chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad brgyad dang bskol ba blud do //
analyzed: sman mar srang drug pa zhes bya ba rtsa ba bcu pa bskol ba'i chu dang zho ga chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad brgyad dang bskol ba blud do //
translated: The so-called six-ounce medicinal butter is prepared by boiling the ten roots in one hundred and twenty-eight ounces of water and milk.

original: yang na dong gra srang gsum dang mar dang til mar srang bcu drug dang / de bzhin du zho ga chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bskol te mar lus pa dang de las ran par 'thungs na dmu rdzing gi nad thams cad 'joms te /
analyzed: yang na dong gra srang gsum dang mar dang til mar srang bcu drug dang / de bzhin du zho ga chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bskol te mar lus pa dang de las ran par 'thungs na dmu rdzing gi nad thams cad 'joms te /
translated: Alternatively, one should boil three ounces of long pepper, sixteen ounces of butter and sesame oil, and one hundred and twenty-eight ounces of milk and water. If one drinks the remaining butter in a suitable amount, it will destroy all diseases of dropsy.

original: khyad par du yang bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: khyad par du yang bad kan dang rlung las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing 'joms pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: In particular, it is the best for destroying the dropsy that arises from phlegm and wind.

original: mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mar de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi chu dang chu'i nyis 'gyur gyi ba gcin dang / tsi tra ka srang gcig gi phye ma bskol te mar lus pa dang / thal sman dang lhan cig dmu rdzing can gyi nad pa la blud par bya'o //
analyzed: mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / mar de'i bzhi 'gyur gyi chu dang chu'i nyis 'gyur gyi ba gcin dang / tsi tra ka srang gcig gi phye ma bskol te mar lus pa dang / thal sman dang lhan cig dmu rdzing can gyi nad pa la blud par bya'o //
translated: Thirty-two palas of ghee, four times that amount of water, twice that amount of urine, and one pala of powdered Citraka should be boiled together. The remaining ghee, along with the ash medicine, should be given to the patient with ascites.

original: yang na ni nas dang / rgya shug dang / rgya sran dang / rtsa ba bcu pa tshul bzhin bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du chang dang / rang skyur dang / mar dang bsres @241b te yang bskol te mar lus pa blud do //
analyzed: yang na ni nas dang / rgya shug dang / rgya sran dang / rtsa ba bcu pa tshul bzhin bskol ba'i khu ba'i nang du chang dang / rang skyur dang / mar dang bsres @241b te yang bskol te mar lus pa blud do //
translated: Alternatively, barley, jujube, kidney beans, and the ten roots should be properly boiled in water, mixed with wine, sour gruel, and ghee, boiled again, and the remaining ghee should be given.

original: mar da rnams kyi sbyor ba de dag gis khong snum zhing lus kyi nyams stobs skyed la /
analyzed: mar da rnams kyi sbyor ba de dag gis khong snum zhing lus kyi nyams stobs skyed la /
translated: By these preparations of ghee, the abdomen becomes oily and the body gains strength.

original: rlung zhi zhing nad rang gi gnas las bskyod pa dang / chog grub pa las 'byung ba'i bkru sman bya'o //
analyzed: rlung zhi zhing nad rang gi gnas las bskyod pa dang / chog grub pa las 'byung ba'i bkru sman bya'o //
translated: The wind is pacified, the disease is shaken from its place, and the purgative medicine arising from the accomplishment of the rite should be given.

original: pa to la'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / skyer pa dang byi dang ga dang / 'di rnams zho gnyis gnyis dang / ka pi lya zho bzhi bzhi dang / ni li ni zho drug dang / tri bi tsa zho brgyad dang /
analyzed: pa to la'i rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / skyer pa dang byi dang ga dang / 'di rnams zho gnyis gnyis dang / ka pi lya zho bzhi bzhi dang / ni li ni zho drug dang / tri bi tsa zho brgyad dang /
translated: kapilya, four zho each, nilini, six zho, and trivitsa, eight zho.

original: 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma gcin dang sbyar ba'i bkru sman blud do //
analyzed: 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma gcin dang sbyar ba'i bkru sman blud do //
translated: Mix these powders with urine and administer as a purgation.

original: des legs par 'khrus pa dang / thug pa dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha khu sbyin no //
analyzed: des legs par 'khrus pa dang / thug pa dang / srog chags thang la gnas pa'i sha khu sbyin no //
translated: When well purged, give porridge and the meat soup of animals living on dry land.

original: de nas zhag drug gi bar du 'o ma tsha ba gsum dang tshul bzhin bskol ba blud do //
analyzed: de nas zhag drug gi bar du 'o ma tsha ba gsum dang tshul bzhin bskol ba blud do //
translated: Then for six days, give warm milk boiled with the three hot medicines.

original: phye ma'i sbyor ba de dag yang dang yang du byas na dmu rdzing thams cad 'joms so //
analyzed: phye ma'i sbyor ba de dag yang dang yang du byas na dmu rdzing thams cad 'joms so //
translated: If these powder compounds are repeatedly prepared, they will conquer all types of ascites.

original: yang na bi sha la dang / shang gi ni dang / dan ti dang / seng phrom gyi shun lpags dang / shu dag dang 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma kar ka na du dang / rgun 'brum dang / rgya shug dang / 'di rnams kyi khu ba ba gcin dang sbrang chang gang yang rung ba dang lhan cig bkru sman gyi don du gtang ngo //🔽la la phud dang / spa ma'i 'bras bu dang / 'u su dang / sha ta pushpa dang / zi ra nag po dang / ka ra b'i ra dang / pi pi ling gi rtsa ba dang / aa dza gandha dang / zur pa dang /

translated: Alternatively, one should administer a powder consisting of the bark of bishala, shangini, danti, and sengdrom, as well as shudag, together with the juice of karkana, grapes, and jujube, together with either urine or fermented mare’s milk.🔽Some recommend a compound consisting of phud, pamari fruit, ushira, shatapushpa, black zira, karavira, the root of pipiling, azagandha, surpa,

original: shu dag dang / zi ra dang tsha ba gsum dang / khron bu dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / thal ba rnam gnyis dang / ma nu dang / ru rta dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang / phyi dang ga dang / 'di rnams cha snyoms pa dang /
analyzed: shu dag dang / zi ra dang tsha ba gsum dang / khron bu dang / 'bras bu gsum dang / thal ba rnam gnyis dang / ma nu dang / ru rta dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang / phyi dang ga dang / 'di rnams cha snyoms pa dang /
translated: shudag, zira, the three hot medicines, khondhu, the three fruits, the two types of ash, manna, ruta, the five types of salt, phyi and ga, all in equal parts.

original: dan ti cha gsum dang / dri bid ta dang / bi sha la cha gnyis dang / sa ta la cha bzhi dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma ni sred med kyi bu'i phye ma zhes bya ste /

original: 'di bsten na khyab 'jug gis lha ma yin bcom pa bzhin du nad kyi tshogs du mas btab pa'i nad mi 'phel zhing sel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di bsten na khyab 'jug gis lha ma yin bcom pa bzhin du nad kyi tshogs du mas btab pa'i nad mi 'phel zhing sel bar byed do //

original: dmu chu la ni dar ba las gtang ngo //🔽rlung gis lto sbo ba la ni chang las gtang ngo //🔽rlung nad la ni chang bkrus pa las gtang ngo //

translated: For ascites, it should be given with curd.🔽For a distended stomach due to vata, it should be given with beer.🔽For vata disorders, it should be given with washed beer.

original: phyis 'gags pa la ni zho ga chu las gtang ngo //
analyzed: phyis 'gags pa la ni zho ga chu las gtang ngo //

analyzed: mche ba'i dug dang / rtsa ba'i dug dang / dug sbyar ma rnams la phan no //

analyzed: rang gi nyams stobs dang sbyar te /

analyzed: sngar snum bag gis brtas la de nas bkru sman gtang bar bya'o //

translated: Take the fruit of Indian beech, Indian night shade, the three fruits, white teak, Indian valerian, Indian licorice, Indian beech, Indian oleander, sweet flag, sea buckthorn, black pepper,🔽and make them into a powder.

analyzed: sha khu 'am ba gcin nam /

analyzed: chu dro 'jam tsam las gtang ba 'di ni skran thams cad dang / mcher pa na ba dang / dmu rdzing thams cad dang / sha bkra dang / mdze dang / lhog pa dang / pho ba'i drod ma snyoms pa dang / lud pa dang /
translated: This decoction is beneficial for all tumors, spleen disorders, ascites, leprosy, smallpox, insanity, stomach heat imbalances, phlegm,

analyzed: gzhang 'brum dang / skya rbab kyi nad dang / mig ser dang / ljang khu kha dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang / bad kan rnams la phan te /
translated: hemorrhoids, edema, jaundice, green-colored mouth, and imbalances of wind, bile, and phlegm.

analyzed: bkru sman 'di rnams kyis myur du sos par byed de /
translated: These purgative medicines quickly cure [these conditions].

analyzed: 'di ni spa ma la sogs pa'i phye ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the powder of spha and so forth.

original: ni li ni dang / lcang ma dang / tsha ba gsum dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te 'thungs na /
analyzed: ni li ni dang / lcang ma dang / tsha ba gsum dang / nas tshig 'khus pa'i thal ba dang / lan tshva rnam lnga dang / kru trug tres dang / 'di rnams kyi phye ma mar dang sbyar te 'thungs na /
translated: Take the powder of neem, bamboo, the three hot medicines, the ash of burnt barley husks, the five salts, and krutakara, mixed with ghee.

original: dmu rdzing dang skran sel to //
analyzed: dmu rdzing dang skran sel to //
translated: This cures ascites and tumors.

original: ba 'am / ra'i 'o ma gtang ngo //
analyzed: ba 'am / ra'i 'o ma gtang ngo //
translated: For the purpose of increasing strength, as mentioned above, administer the milk of a camel, cow, or goat.

analyzed: dmu rdzing gi nad tshabs che ba la ni snum dang bcas pa'i bkru sman myur du btang ste /
translated: In the case of a severe edema, administer the decoction medicine with oil immediately.

original: nyam chung ba la ni mi bsdad do //
analyzed: nyam chung ba la ni mi bsdad do //
translated: In the case of a weak patient, do not administer it.🔽Add thirty-two ounces of powdered yellow myrobalan to one hundred and twenty-eight ounces of butter, and heat it over a fire.

original: mar srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi nang du aa ru ra srang sum cu rtsa gnyis btags pa dang lhan cig me la bzhus pa dang / kha gzar gyis dkrug cing nas kyi sbun @242b pa'i nang du zla ba gcig bzhag la /
analyzed: mar srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi nang du aa ru ra srang sum cu rtsa gnyis btags pa dang lhan cig me la bzhus pa dang / kha gzar gyis dkrug cing nas kyi sbun @242b pa'i nang du zla ba gcig bzhag la /
translated: Stir it with a spoon and leave it in a bag of barley chaff for one month.🔽Then, remove it and heat it again.

analyzed: de nas phyung la yang bzhus te yang aa ru ra bskol ba'i chu dang / zho skyur bo dang ldan par bskol te /
translated: Add the water in which yellow myrobalan has been boiled, and sour curd.

original: de las ran par 'thungs na dmu rdzing dang / sbyar ba'i dug dang / gtun lta bu'i nad dang / lto sbo ba dang / skran dang / khong 'bras dang / de bzhin du mdze dang smyo byed dang / brjed byed rnams 'joms par byed do //

translated: If one drinks it in moderation, it will destroy dropsy, poison, diseases like a pestle, distension of the stomach, tumors, abdominal diseases, and likewise leprosy, insanity, and epilepsy.

original: yang na ba'i 'o ma dang / shri khanda dang bcas par bskol te bsgrangs la /
analyzed: yang na ba'i 'o ma dang / shri khanda dang bcas par bskol te bsgrangs la /
translated: Alternatively, one should boil the milk of a cow with a śrīkhaṇḍa and strain it.

original: kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
analyzed: kha gzar gyis dkrugs te /
translated: Stir it with a ladle.

analyzed: de las byung ba'i mar dang shri khanda yang bskol ba'i khu ba dang bcas par 'thungs na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one drinks the ghee that comes from it together with the juice of a boiled śrīkhaṇḍa, the benefits are the same as above.

original: yang na 'o ma srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / shr'i khanda'i 'o ma srang bcu drug dang lhan cig mnan te /
analyzed: yang na 'o ma srang lnga brgya rtsa bcu gnyis dang / shr'i khanda'i 'o ma srang bcu drug dang lhan cig mnan te /
translated: Alternatively, one should press out the milk of a cow with two hundred and twelve ounces of milk and sixteen ounces of śrīkhaṇḍa milk.

original: zhor smin pa dang bsrubs pa'i mar dang / tri bi tsa bcug pa la yang bskol te 'thungs na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhor smin pa dang bsrubs pa'i mar dang / tri bi tsa bcug pa la yang bskol te 'thungs na phan yon gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: If one drinks the ghee from the curds that have ripened and been churned, together with the juice of a boiled trivṛt, the benefits are the same as above.

original: de bzhin du mar bre gang dang / mar gyi brgyad 'gyur gyi 'o ma dang / su dha kshi ra srang gcig dang / dur byid srang drug dang / gong gi phye ma dang 'di rnams dang lhan cig bskol te /🔽mar nyi tshe lus pa blud do //🔽de'i 'og tu thug pa dang / khu bcud mngar po dang 'o ma btung ngo //🔽mar khod par zhu ste 'khrus pa dang / bca' sga bskol ba'i khu ba dron po blud do //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar bre gang dang / mar gyi brgyad 'gyur gyi 'o ma dang / su dha kshi ra srang gcig dang / dur byid srang drug dang / gong gi phye ma dang 'di rnams dang lhan cig bskol te / mar nyi tshe lus pa blud do // de'i 'og tu thug pa dang / khu bcud mngar po dang 'o ma btung ngo // mar khod par zhu ste 'khrus pa dang / bca' sga bskol ba'i khu ba dron po blud do //
translated: Likewise, one part of ghee, eight parts of milk, one part of Sudakshina, six parts of durva, and the above powder are boiled together.🔽The remaining ghee is given.🔽After that, soup, sweet essence, and milk are drunk.🔽When the ghee is digested and the bowels are cleansed, warm soup of boiled barley is given.🔽

translated: Moreover, if wind and so forth enter the stomach and impair the digestive heat,

analyzed: de nas ni kha zas dro ba dang yang bar byas pa'i nad du rtsa ba lnga pa dang / lan tshva dang / skyur dang / snum cung zad dang bcas pa'i thug pa sbyin no //
translated: then one should administer a soup prepared with the five roots, salt, sour [ingredients], and a little oil, and food that is warm and light.

original: yang na nas rnying pa dang / 'bras @248a * //
analyzed: yang na nas rnying pa dang / 'bras @248a * //
translated: Or, one should prepare a soup with old barley,🔽rice,

original: zhag drug cu pa gcin gyis bran te bskams la 'o mas gzhi blangs te thug pa bya ste ci 'dod pa sbyin no //
analyzed: zhag drug cu pa gcin gyis bran te bskams la 'o mas gzhi blangs te thug pa bya ste ci 'dod pa sbyin no //
translated: and sesame, moistened with urine and dried, mixed with milk, and give it as desired.

original: skom du ni bu ram shing bskol ba'i khu ba blud na nad gzhi gsum las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing las bzlog ste /
analyzed: skom du ni bu ram shing bskol ba'i khu ba blud na nad gzhi gsum las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing las bzlog ste /
translated: If one drinks a decoction of boiled sugarcane juice, one will be cured of dropsy caused by the three humors.

original: rang rang gi gnas su zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: rang rang gi gnas su zhi bar byed do //
translated: It will be pacified in its own place.

original: dmu rdzing can kun gyis bsrung bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: dmu rdzing can kun gyis bsrung bar bya ba ni /
translated: The one who has dropsy should be protected from:

original: shin tu dro ba dang / skyur ba dang / rtsub pa dang / lan tshva dang / phyi sa 'gags pa'i zas dang / grang ba dang / lci ba dang / bu ram dang / til las byas pa'i zas dang / chu 'thung ba dang /
analyzed: shin tu dro ba dang / skyur ba dang / rtsub pa dang / lan tshva dang / phyi sa 'gags pa'i zas dang / grang ba dang / lci ba dang / bu ram dang / til las byas pa'i zas dang / chu 'thung ba dang /
translated: very hot, sour, rough, salty, and constipating foods, cold, heavy, molasses, sesame, and water to drink.🔽One should not rely on or frequently use these:🔽green vegetables, and staying in damp places.

original: sngo rngad dang / rlan la 'dug pa dang 'di rnams shas cher mi spyad mi bsten gzhan yang spang bar bya ba 'di dag bya ste /
analyzed: sngo rngad dang / rlan la 'dug pa dang 'di rnams shas cher mi spyad mi bsten gzhan yang spang bar bya ba 'di dag bya ste /
translated: One should also avoid these:

original: lus kyi rtsom pa dang / lam du 'gro ba dang / bzhon pa'i 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rtsom pa dang / lam du 'gro ba dang / bzhon pa'i 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: physical activities, walking on the road, riding, and coming and going.

original: skom du ni dar ba ha cang sla ba yang ma yin ska ba yang ma yin mngar ba yang ma yin pa'i btung ba bsngags te /
analyzed: skom du ni dar ba ha cang sla ba yang ma yin ska ba yang ma yin mngar ba yang ma yin pa'i btung ba bsngags te /
translated: For thirst, a drink is recommended that is neither too sweet, too sour, nor too bitter.

original: de yang nad kyi gzhi dang sbyar te btung ngo //
analyzed: de yang nad kyi gzhi dang sbyar te btung ngo //
translated: Moreover, it should be drunk in accordance with the basis of the illness.

original: de yang rlung las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing la ni /
analyzed: de yang rlung las gyur pa'i dmu rdzing la ni /
translated: For a dropsy caused by wind,

original: na le sham dang / kha ras btab pa sbyin no //🔽bad kan las gyur pa la ni la la phud dang rgyam tsha dang zi ra dang sbrang rtsi dang / tsha ba gsum 'di rnams kyis btab pa sbyin no //
analyzed: na le sham dang / kha ras btab pa sbyin no // bad kan las gyur pa la ni la la phud dang rgyam tsha dang zi ra dang sbrang rtsi dang / tsha ba gsum 'di rnams kyis btab pa sbyin no //
translated: give a drink prepared with long pepper and turmeric.🔽For one caused by bile, give a drink prepared with the three spices, ginger, and honey.🔽For one caused by phlegm, give a drink prepared with the three spices, ginger, and honey.

original: 'dus pa las gyur pa la ni ba tsha can gyi tsha dang / tsha ba gsum gyis btab pa'i dar ba sbyin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa las gyur pa la ni ba tsha can gyi tsha dang / tsha ba gsum gyis btab pa'i dar ba sbyin no //
translated: For a dropsy caused by a combination of humors, give a drink prepared with the three spices, ginger, and honey.

original: gzhang 'gags pa'i dmu rdzing la ni /🔽spa ma'i 'bras bu dang / la la phud dang / lan tshva dang / zi ra rnams btab pa sbyin no //
analyzed: gzhang 'gags pa'i dmu rdzing la ni / spa ma'i 'bras bu dang / la la phud dang / lan tshva dang / zi ra rnams btab pa sbyin no //
translated: For a dropsy with constipation,🔽give a drink prepared with the three spices, ginger, and honey.

original: rgyu ma rdol ba'i dmu rdzing la ni pi pi ling dang sbrang rtsis btab pa sbyin no //
analyzed: rgyu ma rdol ba'i dmu rdzing la ni pi pi ling dang sbrang rtsis btab pa sbyin no //
translated: For a dropsy with diarrhea, give a drink prepared with long pepper and honey.

original: lto ba chus gang ba'i dmu rdzing la ni /
analyzed: lto ba chus gang ba'i dmu rdzing la ni /
translated: For a dropsy of the abdomen,

original: tsha ba gsum gyis btab pa'i dar ba sbyin no //
analyzed: tsha ba gsum gyis btab pa'i dar ba sbyin no //
translated: give a potion of the three hot herbs with buttermilk.

original: mchin pa'i dmu rdzing la ni /
analyzed: mchin pa'i dmu rdzing la ni /
translated: For a dropsy of the liver,

original: sbrang rtsi dang / shu dag dang / sga dang / nye'u shing dang / ru rta dang / rgyam tsha dang / til mar dang 'di rnams btab pa blud do //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang / shu dag dang / sga dang / nye'u shing dang / ru rta dang / rgyam tsha dang / til mar dang 'di rnams btab pa blud do //
translated: give a potion of honey, cumin, garlic, Indian valerian, Indian sarsaparilla, black pepper, and sesame oil.

original: khyad par du dar ba'i skom gyi phan yon ni /
analyzed: khyad par du dar ba'i skom gyi phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of buttermilk in particular:

original: lus lci ba dang / me'i drod nyams pa dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / tshil rgyas pa'i nad dang / 'khru ba drag pos lus shin tu nyam chung bar gyur pa la ni 'o ma @248b bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus lci ba dang / me'i drod nyams pa dang / yi ga 'chus pa dang / tshil rgyas pa'i nad dang / 'khru ba drag pos lus shin tu nyam chung bar gyur pa la ni 'o ma @248b bdud rtsi dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It is like nectar for those with a heavy body, impaired digestive heat, indigestion, obesity, and a very weak body from severe diarrhea.

original: gso ba'i gnas las dmu rdzing gso ba'i le'u bco lnga ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: gso ba'i gnas las dmu rdzing gso ba'i le'u bco lnga ba rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the fifteenth chapter, on the treatment of dropsy, from The Quintessence Tantra, the Secret Oral Tradition of the Eight Branches of the Science of Healing.

original: // / de nas skya rbab kyi nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas skya rbab kyi nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of ascites will be explained.

original: skyes bu gang skya rbab na ba la ni /
analyzed: skyes bu gang skya rbab na ba la ni /
translated: For a person suffering from ascites,

original: thog mar dge ba'i sman mar dang / ba'i rnam lnga'i sman mar dang / tig ta chen po'i sman mar mdze nad kyi skabs su bshad pa dang / dong ga'i sde tshan bskol ba'i sman mar 'di rnams gang yang rung ba blud do //
analyzed: thog mar dge ba'i sman mar dang / ba'i rnam lnga'i sman mar dang / tig ta chen po'i sman mar mdze nad kyi skabs su bshad pa dang / dong ga'i sde tshan bskol ba'i sman mar 'di rnams gang yang rung ba blud do //
translated: First, administer any of the following medicinal butters: the virtuous medicinal butter, the medicinal butter of the five nectars, the medicinal butter of great Tikta, which is explained in the context of leprosy, and the medicinal butter boiled from the group of Dongga.

original: se'u 'bru rang gi khu ba srang brgyad dang / 'u su srang gnyis dang / tsi tra ka srang gcig dang / bca' sga srang gnyis dang / pi pi ling srang phyed dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma mar srang nyi shu dang / chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang tshul bzhin du bskol te mar lus pa dang ran par 'thungs na snying nad dang skya rbab dang /
analyzed: se'u 'bru rang gi khu ba srang brgyad dang / 'u su srang gnyis dang / tsi tra ka srang gcig dang / bca' sga srang gnyis dang / pi pi ling srang phyed dang / 'di rnams btags pa'i phye ma mar srang nyi shu dang / chu srang brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang tshul bzhin du bskol te mar lus pa dang ran par 'thungs na snying nad dang skya rbab dang /
translated: Take eight ounces of the juice of cherry, two ounces of Usus, one ounce of Citraka, two ounces of Chaga, half an ounce of Pipiling, and twenty ounces of butter, and boil them with one hundred and twenty-eight ounces of water until the butter remains. If one drinks it in the right amount, it cures heart disease, ascites,

original: skran dang / gzhang 'brum dang / mcher pa dang / rlung dang bad kan gyis nyam thag pa sel to //
analyzed: skran dang / gzhang 'brum dang / mcher pa dang / rlung dang bad kan gyis nyam thag pa sel to //
translated: tumors, hemorrhoids, spleen, and the suffering of wind and bile.

original: de'i me drod skyed pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa 'joms shing rlung lam log par zhugs pa lugs bzhin 'byung la /
analyzed: de'i me drod skyed pa dang / dbugs mi bde ba dang / lud pa 'joms shing rlung lam log par zhugs pa lugs bzhin 'byung la /
translated: It increases digestive heat, cures dyspnea and cough, and expels wind that has entered the wrong passage.

original: bud med bu 'byung dka' ba la yang rab tu bsngags so //
analyzed: bud med bu 'byung dka' ba la yang rab tu bsngags so //
translated: It is also highly recommended for women who have difficulty giving birth.

original: de nas skya rbab na ba'i nad pa de snum chos legs par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas skya rbab na ba'i nad pa de snum chos legs par bya ste /
translated: Then, the patient with ascites should be well-oiled.

original: sman rno bas slon bya'o //
analyzed: sman rno bas slon bya'o //
translated: He should be treated with strong medicine.

original: de nas yang snum chos bya ste /🔽'o ma ba gcin dang sbyar ba 'am /
analyzed: de nas yang snum chos bya ste / 'o ma ba gcin dang sbyar ba 'am /
translated: Then, he should be oiled again.🔽He should be repeatedly washed with a mixture of milk and cow's urine,

original: re re yang rung bas lan mang du bkru sma na bya'o //
analyzed: re re yang rung bas lan mang du bkru sma na bya'o //
translated: or with each of them separately.

original: dan ti'i 'bras bu'i khu ba dro 'jam tsam gyi nang du tang pal gyi 'bras bu dang / rgun 'bru'i 'bras bu srang bzhi bzhi bcug ste nub gcig sbangs la /
analyzed: dan ti'i 'bras bu'i khu ba dro 'jam tsam gyi nang du tang pal gyi 'bras bu dang / rgun 'bru'i 'bras bu srang bzhi bzhi bcug ste nub gcig sbangs la /
translated: In the warm and soft juice of date fruits, add four su of each of the fruits of tangpel and grapes, and soak them overnight.

original: nang par mnyes nas btsags pa 'thungs na /
analyzed: nang par mnyes nas btsags pa 'thungs na /
translated: In the morning, churn and strain the mixture, and drink it.

original: skya rbab kyi nad las rgyal bar byed do //
analyzed: skya rbab kyi nad las rgyal bar byed do //
translated: This will conquer the disease of ascites.🔽Alternatively, drink a mixture of cow's urine and powdered Haritaki,

analyzed: yang na ba gcin gyi nang du aa ru ra'i phye mas btab ste btung ba 'am /
translated: Or else, drink a decoction of the three hot herbs with a paste of Arura.🔽

original: yang na 'bras bu gsum ba gcin dang bskol ba'i nang du aa ru ra'i phye ma btab pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu gsum ba gcin dang bskol ba'i nang du aa ru ra'i phye ma btab pa 'am /

original: yang na khron bu dang / sha ma dur byid dang / thang shing dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams ba gcin dang btags te btung ba 'am /🔽yang na sman de dag nyid ba gcin dang bskol ba btung ngo //
analyzed: yang na khron bu dang / sha ma dur byid dang / thang shing dang / bca' sga dang / 'di rnams ba gcin dang btags te btung ba 'am / yang na sman de dag nyid ba gcin dang bskol ba btung ngo //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a compound of Indian berberry, hog’s weed, Indian licorice, and Indian valerian with cow’s urine.🔽Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of these herbs with cow’s urine.

original: yang na sman de dag nyid 'o ma dang tshul bzhin du @249a * //
analyzed: yang na sman de dag nyid 'o ma dang tshul bzhin du @249a * //
translated: Alternatively, one should drink a decoction of these herbs with milk.

original: bskol la 'thungs na nyes pa rnams 'joms so //
analyzed: bskol la 'thungs na nyes pa rnams 'joms so //
translated: In this way, one will overcome the faults.

original: yang na lcags phye ba gcin dang 'o ma gang yang rung ba'i nang du bzhag la sbyin no //
analyzed: yang na lcags phye ba gcin dang 'o ma gang yang rung ba'i nang du bzhag la sbyin no //
translated: Alternatively, one should take iron filings with cow’s urine or milk.

original: de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na 'o ma 'am mngar ba'i khu ba gang yang rung ba lhan cig bza'o //
analyzed: de zhu ba'i tshod tsam na 'o ma 'am mngar ba'i khu ba gang yang rung ba lhan cig bza'o //
translated: When one has digested that, one should eat curd or a sweet drink.

original: de ltar slon khrus kyis stod smad du lus dag par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar slon khrus kyis stod smad du lus dag par byas nas /
translated: In this way, having purified the body above and below with an enema,
